Bagel_text:
To ensure your iPhone's alarm goes off in Do Not Disturb mode, follow these steps:

1. **Open the Settings app** on your iPhone. You can do this by tapping the Settings icon on your home screen.

2. **Tap "Do Not Disturb"**. This option is usually located near the top of the Settings menu.

3. **Tap "Allow Calls From"**. This option allows you to choose who can call you when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

4. **Select "Everyone"**. This option allows all calls to go through, even when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

5. **Tap "Allow Calls On"**. This option allows you to choose when you want to receive calls.

6. **Select "Always"**. This option allows you to receive calls at any time, even when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

7. **Tap "Allow Notifications"**. This option allows you to choose who can send you notifications when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

8. **Select "No One"**. This option allows no one to send you notifications when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

9. **Tap "Allow Notifications On"**. This option allows you to choose when you want to receive notifications.

10. **Select "Always"**. This option allows you to receive notifications at any time, even when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

11. **Tap "Allow Alarms"**. This option allows you to choose who can send you alarms when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

12. **Select "Everyone"**. This option allows all alarms to go through, even when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

13. **Tap "Allow Alarms On"**. This option allows you to choose when you want to receive alarms.

14. **Select "Always"**. This option allows you to receive alarms at any time, even when your iPhone is in Do Not Disturb mode.

15. **Tap "Save"**. This option saves your changes to the Do Not Disturb settings.

16. **Tap "Alarm"**. This option allows you to set an alarm on your iPhone.

17. **Tap "Set"**. This option allows you to set the time for your alarm.

18. **Select the time for your alarm**. You can choose the time for your alarm by tapping the clock icon and selecting the time.

19. **Tap "Save"**. This option saves your changes to the alarm settings.

20. **Tap "Done"**. This option saves your changes to the Do Not Disturb settings and closes the settings app.

By following these steps, you can ensure that your iPhone's alarm goes off in Do Not Disturb mode.

prompt: How to Remove Applications from Your Mac Desktop? Provide screenshot steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Finder app and go to Applications . This folder holds all of the apps installed on your Mac. Some apps are installed by Apple and cannot be deleted by users. Apps like System Preferences, Messages, Photos, Notes, Pages, and Calendar are preinstalled and cannot be removed from your Mac. 2. Select the app you wish to remove in Finder by clicking it once. Click on an app in Finder just once to select but not open the app. Double-clicking on the app you wish to remove will open the app. If you accidentally open an app, you do not need to close it to delete the app. Navigate back to Finder and be sure the app is still selected. You can tell an app is selected if its name is highlighted in Finder. 3. Once an app has been selected, delete it by selecting File > Move to trash . In the top right corner of your Mac screen, find the File tab. Click File and locate the option to Move to trash near the bottom of the pop-up menu. By choosing Move to trash, the selected app will be deleted from Finder and moved to your Mac trash. You can also delete an app by hold-clicking on it in Finder, and then dragging it with your mouse to the trashcan icon in the dock. Deleted apps still in the Trash will continue to take up storage space on your Mac. Empty your trash by clicking the trashcan icon on the app dock and selecting the Empty option in the top right corner of the window. 4. Recover an app by opening the Trash and dragging it back into Applications . If you accidentally deleted the wrong app, open the Trash by clicking on the trashcan icon located in your dock. Find the app you want to recover and hold-click on the app while dragging it with your mouse back into the Applications tab to the left of the files in the trash.

Bagel_text:
Removing applications from your Mac desktop is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to do it:

1. **Open the Applications folder**: Click on the "Finder" icon on your dock, then click on "Applications" in the left sidebar.

2. **Find the application you want to remove**: Browse through the list of applications to find the one you want to remove.

3. **Select the application**: Click on the application to select it.

4. **Drag the application to the Trash**: Drag the selected application to the Trash icon in the dock. Alternatively, you can right-click on the application and select "Move to Trash".

5. **Confirm the removal**: A confirmation dialog will appear. Click "Move to Trash" to confirm the removal.

6. **Empty the Trash**: To ensure the application is permanently removed, you need to empty the Trash. Right-click on the Trash icon in the dock and select "Empty Trash".

Here are the steps in text format:

1. Open the Applications folder.
2. Find the application you want to remove.
3. Select the application.
4. Drag the application to the Trash.
5. Confirm the removal.
6. Empty the Trash.

Remember, removing an application from your Mac desktop does not delete the application from your Mac. It only removes the shortcut from your desktop. If you want to completely remove the application, you will need to delete it from the Applications folder as well.

prompt: How to Record Phone Calls on an iPhone? Show steps with screenshots and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the App Store. It's the blue app with a white "A" made from writing utensils on it. You'll usually find the App Store on the Home Screen. 2. Tap Search . It's in the bottom-right side of the screen and has a magnifying class icon above it. 3. Tap the search bar. This option is at the top of the screen. 4. Search for a phone call-recording app. You'll probably have to spend some money to download a call-recording app. A few of the best-rated apps include the following: TapeACall Pro - You'll pay $9.99 up-front but, unlike most other call recorders, you won't have to pay per-minute. Call Recorder - IntCall - This app is free up-front, while the per-minute recording cost is around $0.10. You'll need to be connected to Wi-Fi to use this service. Call Recording by NoNotes - Free to download and you get 20 minutes of free calls per month. After the free minutes expire, services cost around $0.25 per minute. 5. Tap Get to the right of your selected app. If you're purchasing an app, this button will be replaced by the app's cost instead. 6. Tap Install . It will be in the same location as the Get button. 7. Enter your Apple ID password. Doing so will prompt your app to begin downloading. If you've recently logged into the App Store, you won't have to perform this step. If your iPhone uses Touch ID, you may be able to use your fingerprint here instead. 8. Launch your app and make a call. While the particulars will vary from app to app, they all work in essentially the same way. You'll be connected to their servers and then the call will be merged with the line you are calling. If prompted, you may need to accept the Terms and Conditions and enter your phone number. When the call is merged, the recording begins. When the call ends or you've gone over the allotted or available recording time, the recording is terminated automatically. 9. Play back your call. The calls are stored either in the cloud or on your provider's servers and will be displayed in a list. For Call Recorder - IntCall, tap "Recording" at the bottom of the screen to bring up a list of your recordings, then tap the "Play" button to play back a specific recording. Some services even provide online storage, management, and retrieval. You can often edit your calls, trimming to only the parts of the call you want to save. From there, you can email or manage the recordings as you would any other computer file.

text_rubrics.criterion: The answer must state that recording phone calls on an iPhone requires a third-party app from the App Store, as there is no native/built-in feature.
The answer must provide a clear, step-by-step process for finding and installing a call-recording app from the App Store.

Bagel_text:
Recording phone calls on an iPhone is not possible through the built-in features of the iPhone. However, you can use third-party apps or services to record phone calls. Here are the steps to record phone calls using third-party apps:

1. **Download and Install a Recording App:**
   - Go to the App Store on your iPhone.
   - Search for "phone call recorder" or "call recorder."
   - Choose an app that suits your needs and install it.

2. **Open the Recording App:**
   - After installation, open the app from your home screen or app library.

3. **Set Up the Recording App:**
   - Follow the app's instructions to set up the recording app. This may involve granting permissions for the app to access your microphone and phone calls.

4. **Dial a Phone Number:**
   - Make a phone call to the number you want to record.

5. **Start Recording:**
   - While the call is in progress, open the recording app and start recording. The app will usually prompt you to start recording when you answer the call.

6. **Stop Recording:**
   - When you want to stop recording, open the recording app and stop the recording. The app will save the recording to your device.

7. **Review and Save the Recording:**
   - The recording app will usually provide options to review and save the recording. Review the recording to ensure it is complete and clear, then save it to your device.

8. **Share the Recording:**
   - If you want to share the recording with others, the app may provide options to share it via email, messaging apps, or other platforms.

Remember, recording phone calls without the consent of the other party is illegal in many countries. Always ensure that you have the legal right to record a call before doing so.

prompt: How to Show Image Previews in Windows 10 & 11? Provide steps with screenshots and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open File Explorer . Click the folder icon at the bottom of the screen, or press the Windows key + E key on your keyboard at the same time. 2. Open a folder. You'll need to enable image previews for folders individually. Using the File Explorer's left-hand column of folders, navigate to the folder in which you want to enable image previews. 3. Click the View tab. It's on the upper-left side of the File Explorer window. A toolbar will drop down from the top of the window. 4. Click the Options icon. This icon is in the toolbar at the upper-right corner of the window. 5. Click the View tab. It's at the top of the pop-up window. 6. Uncheck the "Always show icons, never thumbnails" box. You'll find this in the "Files and Folders" section near the bottom of the window. If you don't see this box, double-click the "Files and Folders" heading to make it appear. If this box is already unchecked, you may have to fix the corrupted thumbnail cache . 7. Click Apply , then click OK . Both options are at the bottom of the window. Doing so will apply your settings and close the window. 8. Make sure your folder is displaying the proper viewing option. To see image thumbnail previews, your folder must display files and folders using a supported viewing option (e.g., Extra large icons ). To change the current view setting, do the following: Click the View tab. Click one of the following "Layout" options: Extra large icons , Large icons , Medium icons , Tiles , or Content . If you cannot see image previews after following these steps, you'll need to fix the corrupted thumbnail cache .

Gemini_text:
### Enabling Image Previews in Windows 10 & 11

Windows 10 and 11 offer a convenient way to preview images directly within File Explorer, without needing to open each file individually. This can significantly speed up your browsing and selection process. Here's how to enable it:

**Step 1: Open File Explorer**

Navigate to File Explorer. You can do this by clicking the folder icon on your taskbar, or by pressing the `Windows key + E`.

**Step 2: Access the 'View' Tab**

Once in File Explorer, locate and click on the 'View' tab at the top of the window.

**Step 3: Select 'Options'**

Within the 'View' tab, look for the 'Options' button on the far right. Click on it to open Folder Options.

**Step 4: Navigate to the 'View' Tab in Folder Options**

In the 'Folder Options' window, click on the 'View' tab.

**Step 5: Uncheck 'Always show icons, never thumbnails'**

Scroll down the 'Advanced settings' list until you find the option 'Always show icons, never thumbnails'. Make sure this box is **unchecked**. If it's checked, Windows will only display generic icons for your image files instead of their previews.

Bagel_text:
To show image previews in Windows 10 and 11, follow these steps:

1. **Open File Explorer**: Click on the File Explorer icon on your taskbar or press the Windows key + E to open it.

2. **Navigate to the Image**: Find the image you want to preview in File Explorer. You can do this by browsing through your folders or using the search bar at the top of File Explorer.

3. **Right-Click on the Image**: Once you have located the image, right-click on it.

4. **Select "Properties"**: From the context menu that appears, select "Properties". This will open the Properties window for the image.

5. **Go to the "Details" Tab**: In the Properties window, click on the "Details" tab at the top.

6. **Enable "Show Preview":** In the Details tab, you will see a checkbox labeled "Show preview". Check this box to enable image previews.

7. **Apply and OK**: Click "Apply" and then "OK" to save the changes.

8. **Verify the Preview**: Close the Properties window and open File Explorer again. If you navigate back to the image, you should now see a preview of the image in the Details tab of the Properties window.

9. **Close File Explorer**: You can now close File Explorer.

That's it! You should now have image previews enabled in Windows 10 and 11. If you want to disable the preview feature, simply uncheck the "Show preview" box in the Properties window and follow the same steps to apply and OK the changes.

prompt: How to Delete Photos from Your iPhone and Avoid Syncing to iCloud? Show visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Settings app on your iPhone . It has an icon that resembles two silver gears. You can prevent photos from being deleted from your iCloud by disabling iCloud Photos sync in Settings. Warning: There is a drawback to this method. While you can delete photos from your iPhone without deleting them from iCloud, reenabling iCloud photo syncing in the future will resync your photos and remove all of the deleted ones from iCloud. Only use this method if you won't be using iCloud photo syncing again. 2. Tap your Name/Apple ID. It's at the top of the Settings menu next to your profile icon. 3. Tap iCloud . It's next to an icon that resembles a blue cloud. 4. Tap Photos . It's next to an icon that resembles a colorful pinwheel. 5. Toggle off "Sync with iCloud." It's the first option below the colorful pinwheel icon at the top of the menu. This disables sync between iPhone and iCloud and allows you to delete photos on your iPhone without deleting them on iCloud. If you have "Optimize iPhone Storage" enabled, you will be asked if you want to Remove from iPhone or Download Photos & Videos . Either option will allow you to delete your photos from your iPhone without deleting them from your iCloud. 6. Sign out of your Apple ID. If you sign out of your Apple ID on your iPhone, all your data and photos will still be stored on your iCloud account. You can then use a different Apple ID on your iPhone to keep your photos in your original iCloud account. To sign out: Open the Settings app. Tap your Name/Apple ID at the top of the menu. Tap Sign Out . Enter your Apple ID password. Tap the toggle switch next to the items you want to keep. Tap Sign Out again to confirm. 7. Sign in with a different Apple ID. To do so, you will first need to create a new Apple ID . Then, you can use the following steps to sign in: Open the Settings app. Tap Sign in to your iPhone . Sign in with your new Apple ID username and password. If you don't have a new Apple ID, tap Don't have an Apple ID or forgot it and follow the prompts to create a new Apple ID. Choose whether or not you want to merge your iPhone data with iCloud. Enter the verification code. 8. Choose whether or not to merge your iPhone data with iCloud. If you want to merge your iPhone data with your new iCloud account, tap Merge . If you do not, tap Don't Merge . 9. Delete your photos. Use the following steps to delete your photos once you disable iCloud Photos sync: Open the Photos app. Tap the All Photos tab. Tap Select in the upper-right corner. Gemini_text:
Here's how to delete photos from your iPhone without syncing them to iCloud:

**Step 1: Disable iCloud Photos (if enabled)**

First, you need to make sure your iPhone isn't actively syncing photos to iCloud.

Go to **Settings** > tap on your **Apple ID (your name at the top)** > **iCloud** > **Photos**.

If "Sync this iPhone" is toggled on, toggle it off. You may get a prompt asking what you'd like to do with the photos that have already been uploaded to iCloud. Choose "Download Photos & Videos" if you want to keep copies of all your photos on your device, or "Remove from iPhone" if you're sure you want to delete them. **Step 2: Delete Photos from the Photos App**

Now that iCloud Photos is disabled, you can delete photos directly from your iPhone without affecting your iCloud library (if you chose to keep them in iCloud previously).

Open the **Photos app** on your iPhone.
Tap **Select** in the top right corner. **Step 3: Select Photos to Delete**

Tap on the photos you want to delete. A blue checkmark will appear on selected photos. To select multiple photos quickly, tap and drag your finger across them. **Step 4: Confirm Deletion**

Once you've selected all the photos you want to delete, tap the **trash can icon** in the bottom right corner.
A confirmation message will appear. Tap **Delete [Number] Photos** to confirm.

Gemini_text:
Unlocking an Android device when you've forgotten your PIN can be a bit tricky, but there are several methods you can try. Here’s a breakdown of common approaches:

### Method 1: Google Account (Android 4.4 and Older)

This method works if your device is running Android 4.4 KitKat or an older version. Newer Android versions have removed this specific feature for security reasons.

**Step 1: Incorrect PIN Attempts**
Enter an incorrect PIN several times until you see an option like "Forgot pattern," "Forgot PIN," or "Forgot password" appear on the screen.

**Step 2: Enter Google Account Details**
Tap on the "Forgot PIN" (or similar) option. You'll then be prompted to enter the Google Account username and password that was previously synced with the device.
 

**Step 3: Reset PIN**
Once you've successfully entered your Google Account details, your phone should unlock, and you'll be given the option to set a new PIN.

### Method 2: Find My Device (Google Account)

This method works for most modern Android devices and requires that "Find My Device" (formerly Android Device Manager) was enabled on your phone and it has an active internet connection.

**Step 1: Access Find My Device**
On a computer or another mobile device, go to google.com/android/find and sign in with the Google Account that is linked to your locked phone.

**Step 2: Select Your Device**
If you have multiple Android devices, select the one you want to unlock from the list.

**Step 3: Choose "Erase Device" (Last Resort)**
You'll see options like "Play Sound," "Secure Device," and "Erase Device."
 

*   **"Secure Device":** In some cases, this option allows you to set a new password or PIN, but this feature can vary by Android version and device manufacturer. It's worth trying first.
*   **"Erase Device":** This is a drastic measure, as it will factory reset your phone, deleting all data (photos, apps, messages, etc.). However, it will also remove the PIN lock. After erasing, you'll need to set up your phone again, including setting a new lock screen.

### Method 3: Factory Reset (Recovery Mode)

If the above methods don't work, a factory reset via Recovery Mode is usually the final solution, but it will erase all data on your phone.

**Step 1: Power Off Your Phone**
Turn off your Android device completely.

**Step 2: Enter Recovery Mode**
This step varies depending on your phone's manufacturer. Common combinations include:
*   Volume Down + Power button
*   Volume Up + Power button
*   Volume Down + Home + Power button
*   Volume Up + Home + Power button

Press and hold the correct combination until you see the Android logo or the Recovery Mode menu.
 

**Step 3: Navigate and Select "Wipe data/factory reset"**
Use the Volume buttons to navigate through the menu options and the Power button to select. Find "Wipe data/factory reset" and select it. Confirm your choice when prompted.

**Step 4: Reboot System**
Once the reset is complete, select "Reboot system now." Your phone will restart, and you'll go through the initial setup process as if it were a new device.

### Important Considerations:

*   **Backup:** Always back up your Android device regularly to avoid data loss in situations like this.
*   **Google Account:** Remember your Google Account credentials. They are crucial for unlocking your device or recovering it after a factory reset.
*   **Manufacturer Specifics:** Some manufacturers (like Samsung, LG) offer their own device management services that can remotely unlock or wipe your device. Check your manufacturer's website for more information.

Bagel_text:
Unlocking a pin lock on an Android device is a straightforward process that can be done in a few simple steps. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to unlock a pin lock on an Android device:

**Step 1: Go to Settings**
Open the "Settings" app on your Android device. It's usually represented by a gear icon.

**Step 2: Tap on "Security"**
In the Settings menu, scroll down and tap on "Security." This will open the security settings where you can manage various security features on your device.

**Step 3: Tap on "Fingerprint, Face & Pattern"**
In the Security settings, you'll see a list of security features. Tap on "Fingerprint, Face & Pattern" to access the screen lock settings.

**Step 4: Tap on "Screen Lock"**
In the Fingerprint, Face & Pattern settings, tap on "Screen Lock" to manage the screen lock settings.

**Step 5: Tap on "Pin"**
In the Screen Lock settings, you'll see a list of screen lock options. Tap on "Pin" to manage the pin lock settings.

**Step 6: Enter Your Current Pin**
Enter your current pin to unlock the screen lock settings. This is necessary to ensure that you have the correct pin to unlock the device.

**Step 7: Tap on "Forgot Pin"**
Once you've entered your current pin, tap on "Forgot Pin" to proceed with unlocking the pin lock.

**Step 8: Enter Your New Pin**
Enter your new pin in the provided fields. Make sure to enter the same pin twice to confirm it.

**Step 9: Tap on "Set"**
After entering your new pin, tap on "Set" to save the changes.

**Step 10: Confirm Your New Pin**
You'll be prompted to confirm your new pin. Enter your new pin again to confirm it.

**Step 11: Tap on "OK"**
Once you've confirmed your new pin, tap on "OK" to complete the process.

That's it! Your pin lock has been unlocked, and you can now use your new pin to lock and unlock your Android device.

Here's a visual representation of the steps:

1. Open the "Settings" app.
2. Tap on "Security."
3. Tap on "Fingerprint, Face & Pattern."
4. Tap on "Screen Lock."
5. Tap on "Pin."
6. Enter your current pin.
7. Tap on "Forgot Pin."
8. Enter your new pin.
9. Tap on "Set."
10. Confirm your new pin.
11. Tap on "OK."

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

prompt: How to change language in Microsoft Word? Show screenshot steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open Word. This document icon looks like two pieces of paper, one with a bunch of lines and one with a large "W." You can find this app on your Home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. 2. Tap the icon that looks like a pencil and an "A" at the top of your screen. This will open the editing menu. 3. Tap Home . You'll see a list of options. 4. Tap Review . The menu options to the right will change. 5. Tap Proofing and Language . The options in the menu will change again. 6. Tap the right-pointing arrow next to the current language. You'll see a list of languages. 7. Tap the language you want for your document. You'll be redirected back to the previous menu. You can tap to select boxes next to "Hide All Proofing Marks" and "Hide Proofing Marks in Selected Text" if you want your current text to remain un-edited.

Here's how to change the language in Microsoft Word:

4.  Under "Office display language," you will see a list of installed languages. Select the language you want to use and click **"Set as Preferred."**
    
5.  If the language you want isn't listed, click on **"Add a Language..."**
    
6.  A new dialog box will appear showing available languages. Select the language you wish to add and click **"Add."**
    
7.  Once the language is added, you might be prompted to restart Word for the changes to take effect. Click **"OK"** on the Word Options window, then close and reopen Word.

prompt: How to Change the IP Address on a Mac? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Install a VPN from the App Store. The easiest way to change your IP address on a Mac is to use a VPN (virtual private network). The VPN will mask your computer’s public IP address by routing your internet traffic through a secure server. To get started, install a VPN on your Mac from the App Store or the VPN provider’s website. Some of the most popular VPNs for Mac include Surfshark, ExpressVPN, and NordVPN. Most of these services are available for a low monthly subscription fee. There are also free VPNs available, but they may not be as fast or secure. 2. Create an account and sign in. Once you launch your new VPN software, you’ll be prompted to set up an account. Follow the on-screen instructions to get your VPN up and running. 3. Choose your preferred server. Once you’ve signed in, you can choose from a list of proxy servers to connect to. After you’ve done this, your computer’s public IP address should change based on the server you selected. And that’s it! Enjoy securely surfing the web with your new IP. You can check your public IP address before and after activating the VPN to make sure it’s working right. 4. Click on the Apple logo . You'll see this in the top left corner of your screen. A menu will drop down. A proxy server works similarly to a VPN, but it’s less secure. 5. Click System Settings . You'll see this under "About This Mac." In pre-Ventura versions of macOS, click System Preferences instead. 6. Click Network . Depending on which version of macOS you have, you’ll see this either in the left sidebar or in the main window. 7. Click on the network you’re using. For example, if you’re using a Wi-Fi connection, click on “Wi-Fi.” 8. Click Details… . You’ll see this button next to the name of the network you’re currently connected to. If you’re using a pre-Ventura version of macOS, click the Advanced button at the bottom of the window instead. 9. Click the Proxies tab. Depending on your version of macOS, you'll see this along either the side or the top of the window with tabs for DNS , WINS , 802.1X , TCP/IP , and Hardware . 10. Toggle on the type of proxy configuration you want. You’ll see a list of options to choose from, including “Auto proxy discovery” (which will allow your Mac to automatically search for available proxy servers), “Automatic proxy configuration” (which you can use if you have access to a proxy auto-configuration file, or PAC), and various types of proxy protocols (including HTTP, HTTPS, and SOCKS). In pre-Ventura versions of macOS, you will find these options in a drop-down menu under Select a protocol to configure . Select “SOCKS Proxy” if you are unsure about which protocol to choose. The “SOCKS Proxy” protocol is often used to route network packets between clients and servers through a proxy and is effective at boosting general security and hiding the client address of applications. Web Proxy (HTTP) and Secure Web Proxy (HTTPS) are also commonly used but are less protected than a SOCKS Proxy. 11. Enter the IP address and port in the blank spaces. Once you select a protocol, you’ll see spaces to fill in information about the server. Copy and paste or type in the IP address and port information. If the proxy you’re using requires a password, toggle the switch or tick the box next to “Proxy server requires password.” Enter the login information for the server. Some lists of proxy servers may show the IP address and port separately, while others will display the IP address followed by a : , then the port number. There’s a list of SOCKS proxies here: https://spys.one/en/socks-proxy-list/ . You can find many lists of public proxy servers with a simple web search. Use terms like “Free proxy server list.” 12. Click OK . You will now be connected to the proxy server indicated. Depending on your version of macOS, you may need to click OK and then Apply to save your settings.

Gemini_text:
Here are the steps to change the IP address on a Mac, with an illustration:

**Step 1: Open System Settings**

Click on the Apple menu in the top-left corner of your screen and select "System Settings."

**Step 2: Navigate to Network Settings**

In the System Settings window, click on "Network" in the sidebar.

**Step 3: Select Your Connection**

Choose the network connection you want to modify (e.g., Wi-Fi or Ethernet) from the list. Then, click the "Details..." button next to it.

**Step 4: Configure IPv4**

In the pop-up window, select the "TCP/IP" tab. From the "Configure IPv4" dropdown menu, choose "Manually."

**Step 5: Enter Your IP Address Details**

Now, you can manually enter your desired IP Address, Subnet Mask, and Router (Gateway) information. Make sure these details are correct for your network.

**Step 6: Apply Changes**

Once you've entered the information, click "OK" and then "Apply" in the main Network settings window to save your changes. Your Mac will now attempt to connect using the new IP address.

Bagel_text:
Changing the IP address on a Mac is a relatively straightforward process, but it's important to understand the implications of doing so, as it can affect your internet connectivity and network settings. Here are the steps to change the IP address on a Mac:

**Important Note:** Before proceeding, ensure you have a backup of your important data and settings, as changing the IP address can affect your network configuration and potentially disrupt your internet connection.

**Method 1: Using System Preferences**

1. **Open System Preferences**: Click on the Apple menu in the top left corner of your screen and select "System Preferences" from the dropdown menu.
2. **Click on Network**: In the System Preferences window, click on the "Network" icon.
3. **Select Your Network**: In the Network window, select the network you want to change the IP address for. This is usually the Wi-Fi or Ethernet connection you're currently using.
4. **Click on Advanced**: Click on the "Advanced" button at the bottom of the Network window.
5. **Click on TCP/IP**: In the Advanced window, click on the "TCP/IP" tab.
6. **Change the IP Address**: In the TCP/IP window, you can change the IP address by clicking on the "Configure IPv4" or "Configure IPv6" button, depending on your network type. You can then enter a new IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway.
7. **Click OK**: Click "OK" to save the changes and close the TCP/IP window.
8. **Click Apply**: Click "Apply" to save the changes and close the Advanced window.
9. **Restart Your Mac**: Restart your Mac to apply the changes.

**Method 2: Using Terminal**

1. **Open Terminal**: Click on the "Applications" folder, then "Utilities," and finally "Terminal."
2. **Type the following command**: `sudo ifconfig en0 subnet 192.168.1.100 netmask 255.255.255.0`
   - Replace `en0` with the name of your network interface (e.g., `en1` for Ethernet or `en1` for Wi-Fi).
   - Replace `192.168.1.100` with the new IP address you want to use.
   - Replace `255.255.255.0` with the new subnet mask you want to use.
3. **Enter Your Password**: Enter your Mac's administrator password to confirm the change.
4. **Restart Your Mac**: Restart your Mac to apply the changes.

**Method 3: Using Network Utility**

1. **Open Network Utility**: Click on the "Applications" folder, then "Utilities," and finally "Network Utility."
2. **Select Your Network**: In the Network Utility window, select the network you want to change the IP address for.
3. **Click on Advanced**: Click on the "Advanced" button.
4. **Change the IP Address**: In the Advanced window, click on the "TCP/IP" tab and then click on the "Configure IPv4" or "Configure IPv6" button, depending on your network type. You can then enter a new IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway.
5. **Click OK**: Click "OK" to save the changes and close the Advanced window.
6. **Click Apply**: Click "Apply" to save the changes and close the Network Utility window.
7. **Restart Your Mac**: Restart your Mac to apply the changes.

Remember to always check your network settings and ensure that the changes you make are compatible with your network and internet service provider.

prompt: How to Force Shut Down or Restart a Frozen Mac? Show easy visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Close open programs first, if possible. If your Mac is not completely frozen, close any open apps before you force your computer to shut down. If you have open programs when you force your Mac to shut down, you could lose unsaved work . In some cases, force quitting may even corrupt open programs. If you haven't already tried to shut down your Mac normally, you should do that first. Click the Apple menu and select Shut Down to do so. If a program is hung, you can force quit it . If you have any external devices connected to your Mac, such as a flash drive or external SSD, eject them first . 2. Find your Mac's Power button. If you can't shut down your Mac normally, you can turn it off using the power button or key. To find your Mac's power button: ' MacBook without Touch Bar: The Power key is in the top-right corner of the keyboard. MacBook with Touch Bar: The Power button is the Touch ID section on the far-right side of the Touch Bar. It's actually a button that you can press, even though it doesn't look like it. iMac: You'll find the Power button behind the lower-left side of the iMac's screen. Mac Pro: It's on the top of the computer. 3. Press and hold the Power button for at least 10 seconds. Continue holding down the power button or key until the screen goes black. Once the screen is dark, your Mac will turn off. If you see a prompt asking you to confirm that you want to turn off your Mac, you didn't hold down the key for long enough. 4. Wait a minute before turning back on your Mac. This will allow your Mac to fully power down before you attempt to turn it back on. A completely powered-off Mac will have a black screen. On some Mac computers and MacBooks, you won't be able to see the power light nor will you be able to hear any noise from the drives or the fan. 5. Press and Ctrl + ⌥ Opt + ⌘ Cmd + Power . Pressing these keys at the same time will attempt to safely close all open applications on your Mac before shutting it down. If pressing this combination of keys doesn't shut down your Mac, proceed to the next step. 6. Press and hold Ctrl + ⌘ Cmd + Power . This shortcut is similar to the last, except you're not using the Option key this time, and you'll be holding the keys down for a few extra seconds. Press and hold these keys for about 4-5 seconds before releasing them. This key combination will prompt your computer to turn off without safely closing apps and programs first. 7. Start your Mac in Safe Mode . If your MacBook or desktop freezes again after a forced shut down, restart it and press ⇧ Shift as soon as it begins to turn back on, then release the Shift key when you see the Apple logo. Your computer will start in Safe Mode and attempt to repair issues with your disk. Many applications will not work in Safe Mode. Use it for the next couple of steps, then restart it to return your computer to normal. 8. Disable open on startup . Safe Mode prevents programs from opening automatically on startup. To prevent a program from opening after a normal startup, follow these steps: Open the Apple menu . Click Users & Groups . Select your user account in the left pane. Click the Login Items tab. Select the program causing the issue. Click the - button below the list of programs. 9. Uninstall a problematic program. If you have a specific program that you know is causing your Mac to freeze, uninstalling it (and reinstalling it, if you like) will solve the problem: Open Finder. Click the Applications folder (or click the Go menu and click Applications in the resulting drop-down menu). Find the program that keeps freezing. Drag the program into the Trash. 10. Repair your disk. If your computer still has issues that don't seem tied to a specific program, follow these steps to repair your disk: Restart your computer and hold down ⌘ Command + R as it starts up. Click Disk Utility on the startup screen. Click Continue . Select your startup disk and click Repair Disk . Wait for this to complete (it may take a while), then restart your computer. 11. Reset your SMC. The SMC , or System Management Controller, handles many of the physical components on your Mac. An issue with the SMC can prevent your power button from working properly, or cause general slowdowns. If none of the steps above solved your problem, reset the SMC: Laptop with non-removable battery — Shut down your computer and plug it into a power source. Using the left side of the built-in keyboard, hold down ⇧ Shift + Control + ⌥ Option while pressing the "Power" button, then release all keys, and finally press the "Power" button again. Laptop with removable battery — Shut down your computer. Unplug the power adapter and remove the battery, then hold down the "Power" button for five seconds. Release the "Power" button, reinsert the battery, and plug in your computer to a power source. Press the "Power" button. Desktop — Shut down the iMac and unplug the power cord. Wait fifteen seconds, then plug it back in. Wait five seconds, then press the "Power" button.

Gemini_text:
Here are the steps to force shut down or restart a frozen Mac, with visuals to guide you:

1.  **Force Quit Applications:**
    The first thing to try is force quitting any unresponsive applications. Press **Command (⌘) + Option (⌥) + Esc (Escape)**. This will open the "Force Quit Applications" window. Select the frozen application and click "Force Quit."

    2.  **Force Restart:**
    If your Mac is still unresponsive, you can force it to restart. Hold down the **Power button** (or Touch ID on newer Macs) for about **6-10 seconds** until the screen goes black and the Mac shuts down. Then, press the Power button again to turn it back on.

Bagel_text:
If your Mac is frozen, you can try the following steps to force it to shut down or restart:

**Method 1: Force Quit (Recommended)**

1. Press and hold the **Command (⌘) + Option (封闭) + Esc** keys simultaneously.
2. This will open the **Force Quit Applications** window.
3. In the window, you'll see a list of running apps. Look for the app that's causing the freeze.
4. Click on the app and then click **Force Quit**.
5. If the app is still not responding, you can try **Restart** instead.

**Method 2: Restart Your Mac**

1. Press and hold the **Power** button on the top right corner of your Mac.
2. Hold the button for about 10 seconds until the Mac turns off.
3. Wait for 10 seconds, then press and hold the **Power** button again to turn it back on.

**Method 3: Use Terminal**

1. Open **Terminal** by going to **Applications** > **Utilities** > **Terminal**.
2. Type the following command and press **Enter**:
```
sudo killall Dock
```
3. This will force the **Dock** to restart. If the issue persists, you can try the following command:
```
sudo killall SystemUIServer
```
4. If the issue is still not resolved, you can try the following command:
```
sudo killall Dock
sudo killall SystemUIServer
```
5. Wait for the Mac to restart.

**Method 4: Use Boot Camp Assistant (for Macs with Intel processors)**

1. Restart your Mac and immediately press and hold the **Option (封闭) key**.
2. Select **Boot Camp Assistant** from the boot menu.
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to restart your Mac.

Remember to back up your data before attempting any of these methods, as they may cause data loss.

prompt: How to Change Your Background on Zoom? Provide screenshot steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Enable the Virtual Background feature for your Zoom account. Go to https://zoom.us/signin and sign into your account. Click Settings or My Meeting Settings in the left panel. Scroll down to the "Virtual Background" header in the right panel. If the switch is blue, you are ready to set a virtual background and can move to the next step. If the switch is gray, tap it to turn it blue now, and then restart Zoom. If you don’t see this option or can’t move the switch, ask your team admin to enable Virtual Backgrounds for you. 2. Open the Zoom desktop application and sign in. The app icon looks like a white icon of a video camera on a light blue background that you'll find in either your Windows menu or Applications folder. 3. Click your profile picture. It's in the upper-right area of Zoom. If you don't have a profile picture, this is the first letter of your name. 4. Click Settings . You'll see this grey gear icon at the top of the list. 5. Click Background & Filters . It's in the left panel. As soon as you click this tab, your camera will activate. 6. Select I have a green screen if you have a physical green screen. Though a green (or any solid color) screen isn’t required, it’ll make your background look a lot more realistic. After you click to check the box, follow the on-screen instructions to click your green screen to set it as the background color. For example, if your green screen is white, anything that is white will be replaced with a virtual background. If you don’t have a green screen but do have a recent Intel i5 or i7 processor and see a Download option under “Enable smart virtual background,” click it to emulate a green screen. This makes it so you can select multiple colors in your background and replace them with a single image. A multi-colored background won't allow Zoom's camera settings to replace a single color with another image, so the result will look pixelated and broken.

Gemini_text:
Here's how to change your background on Zoom, with screenshots for each step:

**Step 1: Open Zoom and Join/Start a Meeting**

First, open your Zoom application. You can either join an existing meeting or start a new one.

**Step 2: Access Video Settings**

Once you're in a meeting, look for the video icon in the bottom left corner of the Zoom window. Click the small arrow next to "Stop Video."

**Step 3: Choose Virtual Background**

From the menu that appears, select "Choose Virtual Background..."

**Step 4: Select Your Background**

The "Virtual Background" tab in your settings will open. Here, you can choose from Zoom's default backgrounds or click the "+" icon to upload your own image or video.

Bagel_text:
Changing your background on Zoom is a great way to customize your virtual meetings and make them more professional. Here are the steps to change your background on Zoom:

1. Open the Zoom app on your computer or mobile device.
2. Click on the "Settings" icon in the top right corner of the screen.
3. Click on "Virtual Background" in the left-hand menu.
4. Click on "Add Virtual Background" and select the background you want to use from your computer or mobile device.
5. Click on "Apply" to save your new virtual background.

Here are the steps in text form:

1. Open the Zoom app on your computer or mobile device.
2. Click on the "Settings" icon in the top right corner of the screen.
3. Click on "Virtual Background" in the left-hand menu.
4. Click on "Add Virtual Background" and select the background you want to use from your computer or mobile device.
5. Click on "Apply" to save your new virtual background.

Here is a screenshot of the steps:

prompt: How to Create a Playlist on Spotify? Show visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open Spotify. This app icon looks like a green circle with black sound waves inside it that you'll find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. Log in if you're not already logged in. 2. Tap Your Library . You'll find this in the tabs along the bottom of your screen with the icon of two vertical lines and one diagonal line. 3. Tap Playlists . It's a tab at the top of your screen under "Music" and should be opened automatically. 4. Tap Create playlist . You'll see it next to a tile with a plus sign inside at the top of the "Playlists" menu. 5. Enter a name for your playlist and tap Create . You'll be redirected to the playlist page and can tap Add Songs to add music to the playlist. 6. Add songs to your playlist. Tap the music note and plus sign to the right of songs under "Recommended Songs" to add them to the playlist. You can tap Add Songs from the playlist's page to add music. To edit this playlist, tap it from the "Playlist" menu and tap ⋮ (Android) or ••• (iOS) and Edit Playlist . For more information on editing playlists on Spotify, see How to Edit a Spotify Playlist on iPhone or iPad and How to Edit a Spotify Playlist on Android.

Here's how to create a playlist on Spotify, with visual steps to guide you:

1.  **Open Spotify and Click "Create Playlist"**
    Open the Spotify application or go to the Spotify web player. In the left sidebar, scroll down and click on the "Create Playlist" option.
    
2.  **Name Your Playlist**
    A new playlist will appear in your library. It will have a default name like "My Playlist." Click on this name to edit it. Type in a descriptive name for your playlist. You can also add a description and upload a custom cover image if you like.
    
3.  **Add Songs to Your Playlist**
    Once your playlist is named, you can start adding songs. You can do this in a few ways:
    *   **Drag and Drop:** Find songs, albums, or artists you like and drag them directly into your new playlist in the sidebar.
    *   **Right-Click:** Right-click on any song, then hover over "Add to playlist" and select your new playlist from the list.
    *   **Search and Add:** In the main view of your playlist, Spotify will suggest songs. You can also use the search bar at the top of Spotify to find specific songs, then drag them or right-click to add them.

Creating a playlist on Spotify is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to create a playlist on Spotify, both visually and textually:

**Visual Steps:**

1. Open the Spotify app on your device (computer, mobile phone, or tablet).
2. Click on the "Create" button at the top of the screen.
3. Select "Playlist" from the dropdown menu.
4. Give your playlist a name and add a description (optional).
5. Click "Create" to create the playlist.

**Textual Steps:**

1. Open the Spotify app on your device (computer, mobile phone, or tablet).
2. Click on the "Create" button at the top of the screen.
3. Select "Playlist" from the dropdown menu.
4. Enter a name for your playlist in the "Name" field.
5. Optionally, enter a description for your playlist in the "Description" field.
6. Click "Create" to create the playlist.

That's it! You've successfully created a playlist on Spotify. You can now add songs to your playlist by searching for them and clicking the "Add to" button, then selecting your playlist from the dropdown menu.

prompt: How to create a new Google Doc? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Use Google Docs to make text-based documents. Like the name suggests, Google Docs is a great place to write out documents just like you would with a Microsoft Word document. You can also use Google Docs to share your documents easily with other people, and you’ll always have access to your Google Docs since they’re stored on the cloud, not on your computer. The best part is that Google Docs is completely free—all you’ll need is a Google account to log in. [2] X Expert Source Anar Kazimov Digital Marketing Expert Expert Interview 2. Pick which template you’d like to use based on your document. Google Docs doesn’t just have blank pages; you can also choose letter templates, resumé templates, project proposals, and a few others. Each template has its own color scheme and layout, so you’ll never get bored no matter what you choose. You can try out a few different templates until you see one that you like. 3. Let Google Docs autosave your document. Another perk of Google Docs is that there is no save button—your computer does it for you! Every time you make a change, your document will save itself to your Google Drive, so you don’t have to worry about losing any data if your computer crashes. You can see the autosave working by looking up in the left hand corner. It will tell you when the document is saving and when it’s been saved to your Drive. 4. Go to https://docs.google.com in a web browser. You can use any Windows or macOS web browser to access Google Docs, including Chrome, Safari, and Microsoft Edge. If you don't have a Google/Gmail account, you'll need to create one before you can access Google Docs. 5. Sign in with your Google account. Follow the on-screen instructions to sign in with your Google/Gmail account name and password. This brings you to a list of documents you've opened, edited, or otherwise worked on. You'll also see some options for creating a new document at the top of the screen. 6. Click Blank + to create a blank document. It's in the top-left area of the page. This creates a blank document that you can edit however you wish. If you want to create a new document from a template, click Template Gallery near the top-right corner of the page to expand the list, then click a template to create a new document. Popular template options (such as Resume and Brochure ) appear at the top-center area of the page. 7. Click Untitled document to rename the file. The document is called "Untitled document" by default. To change the title to something other than "Untitled document," press Del to delete the text, and then type a new name for your document. Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return to save your changes. You can also rename your document in the file list on Google Docs. Click the 3 dots in a vertical line on the bottom right of the file, then click “Rename.” You’ve now created your document! From here, you can edit, share, and close your document. 8. Edit your document. As long as you're connected to the internet, Google Docs will save your work as you type. Use the toolbar at the top of the document to adjust the font size, face, color, and style. To adjust the line spacing, click the Format menu, select Line Spacing , and then choose Single , Double , or your preferred option. The Format menu also contains tools for adding columns, headers, footers, headers, and more. To insert an image, table, chart, or special characters, click the Insert menu, choose the item you want to insert, and then follow the on-screen instructions. To change your document to landscape view, open up “File” then click “Page setup.” From there, you can choose “Landscape” or “Portrait.” Google Docs will underline any potential spelling errors—click an underlined word to see suggestions, then click the one you want to use. To spellcheck your entire document, click the Tools menu, and then select Spelling. If you want to download a copy of your document, click the File menu, select Download as , and then choose a format. 9. Share your document. If you want the document to be a collaborative effort with others, you can share it with an individual or group. Here's how: Click the blue Share button near the top-right corner of the page. Enter the email addresses of the people you want to share with, separated by commas. Click the pencil icon to the right of the "People" box to view a list of permissions ( Can view , Can edit , Can comment ), then choose an option. Click Advanced at the bottom-right corner of the Sharing window to see more options, and make changes as needed. Click Send to send a link to the document. 10. Exit the document when you’re done. Click the blue sheet of paper icon at the top-left corner of the page to return to the document list. This will bring you back to all of your Google Docs, so you can open an existing one or create a new one. 11. Edit the document in the future. When you want to work on the document, just return to https://docs.google.com , then click the document's name in the file list.

Gemini_text:
Creating a new Google Doc is a straightforward process. Here's how you can do it:

**Step 1: Go to Google Docs**

Open your web browser and navigate to the Google Docs homepage. You can do this by typing `docs.google.com` into your address bar or by searching for "Google Docs" in your preferred search engine and clicking on the official link.

**Step 2: Sign in to your Google Account**

If you're not already signed in, you'll be prompted to enter your Google account credentials (email or phone and password). If you don't have a Google account, you'll need to create one to use Google Docs.

**Step 3: Start a new blank document**

Once you're on the Google Docs homepage, you'll see an option to "Start a new document." Click on the large, colorful "Blank" template, which usually has a plus sign icon. This will open a new, empty document for you to start working on.

**Step 4: Name your document**

Before you start typing, it's a good idea to name your document. Click on "Untitled document" at the top left of the page, delete the placeholder text, and type in a descriptive name for your document. Google Docs automatically saves your work, so you don't have to worry about manually saving it.

Bagel_text:
Creating a new Google Doc is a straightforward process that can be done in a few simple steps. Here's a step-by-step guide with illustrations to help you create a new Google Doc:

**Step 1: Open Google Drive**

1. Go to the Google Drive website ([drive.google.com](http://drive.google.com)) or open the Google Drive app on your computer or mobile device.
2. Sign in to your Google account if you haven't already.

**Step 2: Click on the "New" button**

1. Once you're logged in, click on the "New" button in the top left corner of the Google Drive interface.
2. This will open a dropdown menu with various options for creating new files.

**Step 3: Select "Google Docs"**

1. In the dropdown menu, click on "Google Docs" to create a new document.
2. This will open a new Google Doc in your Google Drive.

**Step 4: Choose a template (optional)**

prompt: How to Add Subtitles to YouTube Videos? Show screenshot steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open YouTube and click Your Channel . It is near the top of the left sidebar on the homepage. If you don't see it, click the three-line menu at the top-left corner to expand the sidebar. Make sure you are signed in to your YouTube account if you are not already. You can edit a video's subtitles from a computer or via the YouTube Studio app. 2. Press Manage videos . It is atop your channel's page, just beneath your profile picture. You can also access the Video Manager by clicking your account icon in the top right and navigating to YouTube Studio > Content . 3. Select a video. Choose the video to which you want to add subtitles. If you are uploading a video for the first time, you will already be in position to edit and manage that video. 4. Click Subtitles . The page will display your video's current subtitle tracks , if any. 5. Select a language. Use the drop-down menu to select the language you want for your subtitles. You can add additional subtitle tracks in other languages later. If you want to standardize your subtitles across all videos on your channel, check the box next to "Make this the default for my channel". Non-native speakers (and others, like those who are hard of hearing or those with audio processing disorders) may find English language subtitles on English-language videos helpful, so don't be discouraged from subtitling in the video's original language! If you already have a subtitle track, click ADD LANGUAGE before inserting another subtitle track. 6. Click the pencil icon on the subtitle track you want to edit. Hover your mouse over the desired track in the column beneath the Subtitles header. A pencil icon will appear. Click on it to continue. 7. Add your subtitles. There are multiple ways to add subtitles to your YouTube video: Upload file - Add a preexisting subtitle file (SCC, VTT, SRT, SBV) to the video. This wikiHow guide can help you create a subtitle file for your video. Auto-sync - Select this option to type or paste a transcript into the YouTube video editor. YouTube will then attempt to synchronize the text with the audio automatically. Click EDIT TIMINGS to adjust the synchronization. Type manually - Play the video and pause when you want to enter a subtitle. Then, manually enter the text as you listen. Subtitles will be placed in the timeline where you paused the video. Click and drag the bar on either side of the subtitle to change the starting/stopping points. Auto-translate - If you already have a subtitle track in the video's original language, you can then ask YouTube to automatically translate it to another language. 8. Publish the video. When you have completed your subtitling, select PUBLISH and your subtitles will be uploaded to the video.

Gemini_text:
Adding subtitles to your YouTube videos can significantly boost accessibility and reach a wider audience. Here's a step-by-step guide:

**Step 1: Access YouTube Studio**
Log in to your YouTube account and click on your profile picture in the top right corner. From the dropdown menu, select "YouTube Studio."

**Step 2: Navigate to Content**
In the left-hand menu of YouTube Studio, click on "Content." This will display all your uploaded videos.


**Step 3: Select a Video**
Hover over the video you want to add subtitles to and click on the "Details" icon (a pencil icon).


**Step 4: Go to Subtitles/CC**
On the video details page, scroll down and click on "Subtitles" (or "CC" for closed captions) in the left-hand menu.


**Step 5: Add Subtitles**
You'll see options to add subtitles. You can choose from:

*   **Upload file:** If you have a subtitle file (e.g., .srt, .vtt) already prepared.
*   **Auto-sync:** YouTube will try to automatically sync your typed text with the video.
*   **Type manually:** You can type out the subtitles and set their timings yourself.

Choose the method that suits you best and follow the on-screen instructions to add your subtitles. Remember to save your changes when you're done!

Bagel_text:
Adding subtitles to YouTube videos is a great way to make your content more accessible to a wider audience, especially for those who are deaf or hard of hearing. Here are the steps to add subtitles to your YouTube videos:

1. **Log in to Your YouTube Account:**
   - Go to youtube.com and sign in with your Google account.

2. **Select the Video:**
   - Click on the video you want to add subtitles to from your YouTube channel.

3. **Click on the 'Edit' Button:**
   - Look for the 'Edit' button, which is usually located below the video player. Click on it.

4. **Click on 'Subtitles' Tab:**
   - In the editing interface, click on the 'Subtitles' tab.

5. **Click on 'Add Subtitles' Button:**
   - You will see an 'Add Subtitles' button. Click on it.

6. **Choose Your Language:**
   - Select the language of your subtitles from the dropdown menu.

7. **Start Transcribing:**
   - Type in the subtitles for your video. You can use the transcription tool provided by YouTube, which will help you with the timing of the subtitles.

8. **Save Your Subtitles:**
   - Once you have finished transcribing, click on 'Save' to save your subtitles.

9. **Review Your Subtitles:**
   - After saving, you can review your subtitles to ensure they are accurate and well-timed.

10. **Publish Your Subtitles:**
    - Once you are satisfied with your subtitles, click on 'Publish' to make them available for viewers.

11. **Add a Description:**
    - You can also add a description to your video, which can include information about the subtitles, such as the language and the fact that they are available in real-time.

12. **Share Your Video:**
    - Finally, share your video with your audience and encourage them to use the subtitles.

Remember, YouTube will also provide a preview of your subtitles, so you can see how they will look before they are published.

prompt: How to Add Files to Google Drive Online? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open Google Drive. Go to https://drive.google.com/ in your browser. This will open your Google Drive main page if you're logged into your Google Account. If you aren't logged into your Google Account, click the blue Go to Google Drive button in the middle of the page, then enter your Google Account's email address and password. 2. Click NEW . This blue button is in the upper-left corner of the page. A drop-down menu will appear. 3. Select an upload option. Click one of the following options depending on what you want to upload: File upload - Allows you to select a specific file or group of files to upload. Folder upload - Allows you to select an entire folder to upload. 4. Select your file(s) or folder. In the File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac) window that opens, go to the files' or folder's location and click the item that you want to upload. You can select multiple files by holding down Ctrl (Windows) or ⌘ Command (Mac) while clicking each file you want to select. Keep in mind that you can't upload more than 15 gigabytes of files without paying for additional storage. 5. Click Open . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so will confirm your selection and begin uploading the file(s) or folder to Google Drive. If you're uploading a folder, you'll click OK instead. 6. Wait for the file(s) or folder to upload. The amount of time this takes will vary depending on the size of the upload and your Internet connection. Do not close the Google Drive webpage during this time. Once the files finish uploading, you'll be able to access them from Google Drive on any Internet-connected computer or smartphone. 7. Organize your files. Once your files have been uploaded to Google Drive, you can click and drag them to move them into folders if needed. You can also remove unnecessary files by right-clicking them and then clicking Remove . To create a new folder in Google Drive, click NEW , click Folder in the drop-down menu, type in a name, and press ↵ Enter .

Gemini_text:
**Step 1: Go to Google Drive**

First, open your web browser and go to [drive.google.com](https://drive.google.com/). Make sure you're signed in to your Google account. If you're not, you'll be prompted to do so.
**Step 2: Click the "New" Button**

On the left-hand side of the Google Drive interface, you'll see a prominent "+ New" button. Click on this button to reveal a dropdown menu.
**Step 3: Choose "File upload" or "Folder upload"**

From the dropdown menu, you have two main options for uploading:
*   **File upload:** If you want to upload individual files (documents, images, videos, etc.), select this option.
*   **Folder upload:** If you want to upload an entire folder with its contents, select this option.
**Step 4: Select Your Files or Folder**

After clicking "File upload" or "Folder upload," a new window will appear, allowing you to browse your computer's files. Navigate to the location of the file(s) or folder you wish to upload, select them, and then click "Open" (or "Upload" for folders).
**Step 5: Monitor the Upload Progress**

A small pop-up window in the bottom right corner of your screen will show the upload progress. Once the upload is complete, you'll see a green checkmark, and your files or folder will appear in your Google Drive.

Bagel_text:
Adding files to Google Drive online is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to follow:

**Visual Steps:**

1. Open your web browser and go to drive.google.com.
2. Sign in to your Google account if you haven't already.
3. Click on the "New" button in the top left corner of the Google Drive interface.
4. Select "File upload" from the dropdown menu.
5. Click on the "Select files" button to choose the files you want to upload.
6. Select the files from your computer or device.
7. Click "Open" to upload the files.
8. Wait for the files to upload. You can see the progress in the top right corner of the screen.
9. Once the files have uploaded, you can see them in your Google Drive.

**Text Steps:**

1. Open your web browser and go to drive.google.com.
2. Sign in to your Google account if you haven't already.
3. Click on the "New" button in the top left corner of the Google Drive interface.
4. Select "File upload" from the dropdown menu.
5. Click on the "Select files" button to choose the files you want to upload.
6. Select the files from your computer or device.
7. Click "Open" to upload the files.
8. Wait for the files to upload. You can see the progress in the top right corner of the screen.
9. Once the files have uploaded, you can see them in your Google Drive.

That's it! Your files should now be added to your Google Drive online.

Gemini_text:
Here are the steps to activate your camera in Windows 10, with a visual guide:

**Step 1: Check Camera Privacy Settings**
First, you need to make sure your camera is enabled in Windows privacy settings.
Go to **Start Menu** > **Settings** > **Privacy** > **Camera**.
 directed at the Camera option within the Privacy settings.

**Step 2: Ensure Camera Access is On**
On the Camera privacy settings page, make sure that "Camera access for this device" is **On**. If it's off, click the "Change" button and toggle it on. Also, ensure "Allow apps to access your camera" is **On**.
 shows the toggles for "Camera access for this device" and "Allow apps to access your camera" both set to "On".

**Step 3: Choose Which Apps Can Access Your Camera**
Scroll down on the same Camera privacy settings page to find "Choose which apps can access your camera". Here, you can individually enable or disable camera access for specific desktop apps and Microsoft Store apps. Make sure the app you want to use the camera with is toggled **On**.
 depicts the list of applications with individual toggles for camera access.

**Step 4: Check Device Manager (if camera isn't working)**
If your camera still isn't working, it might be disabled in Device Manager or have a driver issue.
Right-click the **Start Menu** and select **Device Manager**.
 indicates the Device Manager option in the right-click Start menu.

**Step 5: Enable Camera in Device Manager**
In Device Manager, look for "Cameras" or "Imaging devices." Expand this section, right-click on your camera device (e.g., "Integrated Webcam"), and select "Enable device" if it's disabled. If it's already enabled, you might try "Update driver" or "Uninstall device" (then restart your PC to reinstall the driver).
 of the Device Manager with the "Cameras" section expanded and a right-click menu showing "Enable device," "Update driver," and "Uninstall device."

Bagel_text:
Activating the camera in Windows 10 is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to follow:

1. **Open Settings**: Click on the Start button and select "Settings" from the menu. Alternatively, you can press the Windows key + I to open Settings directly.

2. **Go to Devices**: In the Settings window, click on "Devices" from the left menu.

3. **Select Camera**: In the Devices settings, click on "Camera" from the list of options.

4. **Turn On Camera**: In the Camera settings, you will see a toggle switch. Click on the switch to turn on the camera. The switch will change from gray to blue, indicating that the camera is now active.

5. **Test the Camera**: To test the camera, you can click on the "Test" button. This will open the Camera app, allowing you to see yourself or any other object in front of the camera.

6. **Close the Camera App**: Once you are satisfied that the camera is working, you can close the Camera app by clicking on the "X" button in the top right corner.

7. **Close Settings**: Finally, you can close the Settings window by clicking on the "X" button in the top right corner.

These steps should help you activate the camera in Windows 10. If you encounter any issues, you can try restarting your computer or checking for any updates to the camera driver.

prompt: How to use Split Screen on Android? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Recent Apps menu. The Recent Apps menu shows all the apps you currently have open. The way you access the Recent Apps menu varies depending on your phone model and which version of Android you are running. Use one of the following steps to access the Recent Apps menu. Gestures: If you are using Android 10 gestures, simply swipe up from the bottom of the screen. Pill Button: If your phone has an on-screen button that looks like a pill at the bottom-center, swipe up from the pill button. Three-Button Panel: If your phone has three buttons at the bottom of the screen, tap the button that resembles a square, or three vertical lines. 2. Swipe left and right to switch between apps. This navigates between all the apps you have open. Each app is displayed in a small screen in the center. 3. Tap and hold the app you want to open in a split-screen. This displays a pop-up menu. On some Android phone models, you can tap and hold the app screen display in the center of the screen, on other Android models (Samsung Galaxy phones in particular), you'll need to tap and hold the app icon at the top of the app screen display. 4. Tap Spit-screen or Open in split-screen view . This opens the app in split-screen mode. 5. Open a second app. You can either tap a second app on the Recent Apps menu or you can open an app from your home screen or apps menu. This displays both with the screen split down the center. You can adjust the size of the screens by tapping and dragging the blue line that splits the screen in the middle. To exit split-screen mode, tap and drag the blue line that splits the screens completely off-screen.

This shows your recently opened apps. 2. **Select First App:** Tap and hold the app icon at the top of one of the app cards you want to use in split screen. . **Choose "Split Top":** From the menu that appears, tap "Open in split screen" or "Split Top." The selected app will move to the top half of your screen. . **Select Second App:** Now, your recent apps will appear in the bottom half of the screen. Tap on the second app you want to use in split screen. . **Adjust Split (Optional):** You'll see a divider bar between the two apps. You can drag this bar up or down to adjust the size of each app's window.

Bagel_text:
Split Screen on Android is a feature that allows you to multitask by running two apps side by side on your device. Here are the steps to use Split Screen on Android:

**Visual Steps:**

1. Open the app you want to use in Split Screen mode.
2. Tap the recent apps button (usually a square icon) at the bottom of the screen.
3. Find the app you want to use in Split Screen mode and tap and hold it until it starts to shake.
4. Release the app and it will be added to the Split Screen mode.
5. You can now use both apps simultaneously.

**Text Steps:**

1. Open the app you want to use in Split Screen mode.
2. Tap the recent apps button (usually a square icon) at the bottom of the screen.
3. Find the app you want to use in Split Screen mode and tap and hold it until it starts to shake.
4. Release the app and it will be added to the Split Screen mode.
5. You can now use both apps simultaneously.

**Additional Tips:**

* To switch between Split Screen apps, simply tap the app you want to use and it will take over the screen.
* To exit Split Screen mode, simply tap the recent apps button and select the app you want to use.
* Some apps may not support Split Screen mode, so you may not see the option to add an app to Split Screen mode.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

prompt: How to turn off automatic updates in Windows 10? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Press the Windows key on your keyboard. This opens the Start menu and activates the search bar. Understand the limitations of this method. While disabling the automatic update service will temporarily halt any Windows 10 & 11 cumulative updates, the service may re-enable itself in the future after a certain amount of time. 2. Type services , and click Services in the search results. Doing so will open the Services window. You can also press the Windows key + R to open the Run window . Type services.msc and press Enter . 3. Scroll down and double-click Windows Update . Doing so opens the Windows Update Properties window. 4. Click the "Startup type" menu and select Disabled . It's in the middle of the window. Selecting Disabled will prevent the Windows Update service from automatically starting for the time being. If you don't see this option, first make sure that you're on the right tab by clicking General at the top of the Properties window. 5. Click the Stop button. You'll find this option near the bottom of the window. Clicking it prompts the Windows Update service to stop running. 6. Click Apply , then click OK . Both options are at the bottom of the window. Doing so will apply your settings and close the Properties window. The Windows Update service should now be disabled. 7. Check the update service periodically. Any time you restart your computer or go more than two days without shutting down, open Services and check the "Windows Update" status to ensure that it's still disabled. While the Windows Update service shouldn't turn itself back on often, it may occasionally do so. If you see "Disabled" to the right of the "Windows Update" heading, Windows Update is still disabled. If you see anything other than "Disabled" to the right of the "Windows Update" heading, disable the Windows Update again.

Bagel_text:
To turn off automatic updates in Windows 10, follow these steps:

1. Click on the Start button and type "Windows Update" in the search bar. Click on the "Windows Update" option that appears in the search results.

2. Click on the "Change settings" link at the bottom of the Windows Update window.

3. In the "Windows Update Settings" window, uncheck the box next to "Automatically install updates (recommended)".

4. Click on the "OK" button to save the changes.

5. Click on the "Close" button to close the Windows Update window.

6. Click on the "Restart now" button to restart your computer.

7. After your computer restarts, you will need to manually check for updates by clicking on the "Check for updates" button in the Windows Update window.

Note: Turning off automatic updates may leave your computer vulnerable to security risks, so it is recommended to keep your operating system and applications up to date.

prompt: How to check storage space on iPhone? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open your iPhone's Settings. This app is grey with gears on it. You'll likely find it on the Home screen. 2. Tap General followed by iPhone/iPad Storage . This takes you to a page that displays how much storage space you are using as well as a breakdown of how your storage is being used. 3. Review your used and available storage. According to IT expert Gonzalo Martinez, you'll be able to see a nice breakdown of how much storage space you are using as well as where all your data is. You'll also be able to delete apps unused apps to free up space. The bar graph shows how much storage space you have used and how much storage space you have total Subtract the storage space you have used from the total storage space to find out how much storage space you have free. The color coding displays what type of data is taking up storage space on your hard drive. You can see how much data is being used by apps, photos, documents, trash, iOS data, etc. You can scroll down to see exactly how much storage space each app is currently using. You can free up storage space by transferring documents to your iCloud storage or uninstalling or offloading unused apps. Offloading an app will uninstall the app but keep the app data on your device in case you want to use it again. To offload an app, scroll down and tap an app you aren't currently using. Tap Delete to uninstall it or tap Offload app to offload it.

prompt: How to update macOS? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Befor you start, make sure your Mac is pluggd into power and connected to the internet. It's also a good idea to back up your Mac using time machine. 2. From the Apple menu  in the corner of your screen, choose System Settings. 3.
