Taking a screenshot on an Android device is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to take a screenshot on an Android device:

**Visual Steps:**

1. **Press the Power button and Volume Down button at the same time.**
2. **Hold down the buttons for a moment.**
3. **Release the buttons when the screenshot is taken.**

**Text Steps:**

1. **Locate the Power button and Volume Down button on your Android device.**
2. **Simultaneously press the Power button and Volume Down button.**
3. **Hold down the buttons for a moment.**
4. **Release the buttons when the screenshot is taken.**
5. **The screenshot will be saved to your device's gallery or a designated folder.**

**Alternative Method:**

If you have a newer Android device with a gesture-based navigation system, you can take a screenshot by swiping down from the top of the screen and holding your finger on the screen for a moment. This will trigger the screenshot.

**Additional Tips:**

* Make sure your device is in landscape or portrait mode, depending on the app you are using.
* If you are using a keyboard, you can also take a screenshot by pressing the Power button and Volume Down button while holding down the Shift key.
* You can also use a third-party screenshot app or a built-in screenshot app to take a screenshot on your Android device.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

prompt: How to Take a Screenshot on a Mac? Provide screenshot steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Press ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + 3 . This keyboard shortcut takes a screenshot of everything on your screen. Make sure your screen displays exactly what you want to show in your screenshot image. Ensure all the relevant windows are visible. If your sound is on, your computer should make a brief camera shutter noise. If you see a thumbnail in the corner, you can click it to edit the screenshot. Otherwise, wait a few seconds for the screenshot to save onto your desktop. 2. Find your screenshot on your desktop. It will be a .png file named "Screen Shot" labeled with the date and time. Earlier versions of OS X will save it as "Picture #"—for example, if it's the 5th screenshot on your desktop it will be labeled "Picture 5". Once you have taken your screenshots, they are now ready to be used as needed. You can attach them to an email, upload them to the Web, or even drag them straight into an application such as a word processor. 3. Press ⌘ Command + ⇧ Shift + 4 . Your cursor will turn into a small crosshair reticle. AppleCare Technician Chiara Corsaro explains, "This [shortcut] will allow you to select what you want specifically." [2] X Expert Source Chiara Corsaro Certified Apple Technician Expert Interview 4. Click and drag your cursor to highlight the area you'd like to take a picture of. A gray rectangle should appear where you drag your cursor. If you need to adjust your windows at all, press Escape to return to a regular cursor without taking a picture. 5. Let go of the mouse. You should hear a brief camera shutter noise if your computer's sound is turned on. That signals that your screenshot has been taken. 6. Find your screenshot on your desktop. It will be a .png file named "Screen Shot" labeled with the date and time. Earlier versions of OS X will save it as "Picture #"—for example, if it's the 5th screenshot on your desktop it will be labeled as "Picture 5". Once you have taken your screenshots, they are now ready to be used as needed. You can attach them to an email, upload them to the Web, or even drag them straight into an application such as a word processor.

Gemini_text:
### How to Take a Screenshot on a Mac

Taking a screenshot on a Mac is a straightforward process, with several options depending on what you want to capture.

**1. Capture the Entire Screen**

To take a screenshot of your entire screen, simply press **Shift + Command + 3** simultaneously. The screenshot will be saved as a file on your desktop.

**2. Capture a Selected Portion of Your Screen**

If you only want to capture a specific part of your screen, follow these steps:

*   Press **Shift + Command + 4**. Your cursor will change into a crosshair.
*   Click and drag the crosshair to select the area you want to capture.
*   Release your mouse or trackpad button to take the screenshot. This screenshot will also be saved to your desktop.

**3. Capture a Specific Window or Menu**

To take a screenshot of a particular window or menu:

*   Press **Shift + Command + 4**, then hit the **Spacebar**. Your cursor will change into a camera icon.
*   Move the camera icon over the window or menu you wish to capture. The window or menu will highlight.
*   Click your mouse or trackpad button. The screenshot of the selected window or menu will be saved to your desktop.

**4. Capture a Screenshot to the Clipboard (instead of saving to desktop)**

If you want to paste a screenshot directly into another application without saving it as a file:

*   **Entire Screen to Clipboard:** Press **Shift + Command + Control + 3**.
*   **Selected Portion to Clipboard:** Press **Shift + Command + Control + 4**, then select your desired area.
*   **Window/Menu to Clipboard:** Press **Shift + Command + Control + 4**, then the **Spacebar**, and click on the window/menu.

After using any of these "Control" key combinations, the screenshot will be copied to your clipboard, and you can paste it (Command + V) into any document or application.

prompt: How to Set Custom Notification Sounds on an Android Phone? Show visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Save a custom sound to your Android. There's a variety of ways to find and save custom sounds. You can download them from a website like notificationsounds.com or you can use an app like Zedge: You can download Zedge for free from the Google Play Store. Although Zedge lets you assign sounds from right in the app, you'll want to download the audio file instead so you can keep using the tones regardless of whether you have Zedge installed. When you find a notification sound you like, tap the download icon and Save to Media Folder. . If you have an audio file (MP3, M4A, WAV, or OGG format) on your computer, transfer it to your Android. One of the easiest ways to do this is to attach the file to an email to yourself and download the attachment on your Android. You can also use a USB cable to transfer the file to your Android device. Some Android phone models only allow you to use WAV or OGG files for notifications and ringtones. 2. Open your file manager app. It usually has an icon that resembles a folder. If you're using a Samsung, it's called My Files . On a Pixel (and many other models), it's called Files . Alternatively, you can download a third-party file manager, such as Cx File Explorer from the Google Play Store. 3. Create a Notifications folder if you don't already have one. Use the file manager to navigate to your Internal Storage and scroll through its contents. Do you see a folder called "Notifications?" If not, tap the menu icon ( ⋮ ) and tap Create folder . Rename the new folder "Notifications." Skip this step if you already have a "Notifications" folder. 4. Navigate to your downloaded audio files. If you downloaded the file, it's likely in your Download folder, but you may have saved it elsewhere. If the file was already on your Android, it may be in the Music folder. Notification sounds that you downloaded from Zedge will automatically save into your "Notifications" folder. However, it's a good idea to look in the folder to make sure the sound you want is there. You're done with this section if you're using Zedge! 5. Copy or move the audio files to your Notifications folder. Your file manager app will let you move or copy this sound file to any directory you want. To do this on a Samsung, tap and hold the audio file, select Move , navigate back to the Notifications folder, and tap Paste . Most other apps work similarly, though you may need to tap a menu after long-tapping the file. 6. Use your new audio file as a notification. Now that you've added your audio file to the correct location, you can use it as your default notification sound , for a specific app , or as a custom text alert .

Here's how to set custom notification sounds on an Android phone, with visual steps:

Bagel_text:
Setting custom notification sounds on an Android phone can enhance your device's personalization and make it easier to identify notifications. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to do it:

### Step-by-Step Guide to Set Custom Notification Sounds on an Android Phone

#### Step 1: Accessing the Sound Settings
1. **Open the Settings App**: Tap on the Settings app icon on your home screen or in the app drawer. The icon is typically a gear or a wrench.

#### Step 2: Navigating to Sound Settings
2. **Scroll Down and Tap on Sound**: In the Settings menu, scroll down and find the "Sound" or "Notifications" option. Tap on it to proceed.

#### Step 3: Choosing a Custom Sound
3. **Select Custom Sound**: In the Sound settings, look for the option to choose a custom sound. This might be labeled as "Custom Sound," "Notification Sound," or "Sound." Tap on it.

#### Step 4: Selecting a Sound File
4. **Choose a Sound File**: You will be presented with a list of available sound files. You can either:
   - **Select from the List**: Choose from the pre-installed sound files.
   - **Add a New Sound**: If you have a specific sound file you want to use, you can add it by tapping on "Add Sound" or a similar option. This will allow you to select a sound from your device's storage or from a music app.

#### Step 5: Setting the Sound for Notifications
5. **Set the Custom Sound for Notifications**: Once you have selected your custom sound, you can set it as the notification sound. Look for the option to set the custom sound for notifications and toggle it on.

#### Step 6: Confirming the Change
6. **Confirm the Change**: A confirmation prompt will appear to ensure you want to set the custom sound. Tap "OK" or "Set" to confirm.

### Additional Tips
- **Use a Short Sound**: For better notification recognition, it's recommended to use a short sound clip.
- **Test the Sound**: After setting the custom sound, test it by sending a notification to ensure it works as expected.
- **Accessibility**: If you have accessibility needs, you can set custom sounds for accessibility features as well.

By following these steps, you can easily set custom notification sounds on your Android phone, enhancing your device's personalization and notification experience.

prompt: How to Delete All Emails in Your Gmail Inbox at Once? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Log into Gmail. Open www.gmail.com in your desktop browser and log in to your account, if you haven't already done so. 2. Click on v More from the left side menu. Then select All Mail from the list. If you want to delete emails by category, select one of the category tabs ( Social, Promotions, Updates, Forums ) from the top menu. 3. Check the box at the top left to select all messages. It's next to the "Compose" button. 4. Click on the “Select all conversations” link. It's displayed as Select all # conversations in All Mail at the top of the page. 5. Click the “Delete” icon that resembles a grey bin, at the top of the page. A confirmation box will pop up. 6. Confirm your action. Click the OK button in the confirmation box to delete all the conversations in your Inbox. 7. Permanently delete your messages, if desired. Your deleted messages will move to the Trash bin. If you want to remove your emails from the bin, select Bin from the left side menu and click on the Empty Bin now link. Click OK button from the dialog box to confirm your action. You're done!

Gemini_text:
Here are the steps to delete all emails in your Gmail inbox at once:

**Step 1: Open Gmail and Select All Conversations**
Go to your Gmail inbox. At the top left, click the small square checkbox. This will select all conversations currently visible on the page (usually 50).
**Step 2: Select All Conversations in Your Inbox**
After selecting the visible conversations, you'll see a banner appear that says "All 50 conversations on this page are selected." Below that, click on "Select all [number] conversations in Primary." This will select every email in your primary inbox.
**Step 3: Click the Delete Icon**
Once all conversations are selected, click the trash can icon (Delete) in the toolbar above your emails.
**Step 4: Confirm Deletion**
A confirmation pop-up will appear asking "Are you sure you want to take this action?" Click "OK" to confirm that you want to delete all selected emails.

prompt: How to Turn Off Your iPhone? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Press and hold a volume button and the right side button simultaneously. It doesn't matter which volume button you press. After holding down these buttons for a few seconds, a slider will appear on the screen. If you don't hold down long enough, you might take a screenshot . 2. Drag the slider to the right. This powers off your iPhone. It can take up to 30 seconds for your iPhone to power down. 3. Press and hold the right side button to turn the iPhone back on. You can lift your finger from the button once the Apple logo appears. You may need to wait a few moments until you can use your iPhone . If your device is unresponsive, you can perform a hard reset . 4. Press and hold the right side button. It's near the top of the phone on the rightmost edge. After a few seconds, a slider will appear. 5. Drag the slider to the right. Swipe the button from the left of the "slide to power off" message to the right and your iPhone will power off. 6. Press and hold the right side button to turn the iPhone back on. You can lift your finger from the button once the Apple logo appears. If you need to force restart an iPhone 7 or 7 Plus, press and hold the Volume down and Power button until you see the Apple logo. Once the logo appears, release both buttons and wait for the device to reboot. To restart an iPhone 8 or 8 Plus, press and release the Volume up button, then press and release the Volume down button. Press and hold the Power button until you see the Apple logo appear. Once that happens, release the power button and wait for the device to reboot. [7] X Expert Source Josef Storzi Apple & Mobile Phone Repair Specialist Expert Interview 7. Press and hold the top button. It's on the top of your iPhone close to the right edge. In a few seconds, a slider will appear. 8. Drag the slider to the right. This powers down your iPhone. It can take about 30 seconds for your iPhone to turn off. 9. Press and hold the top button to turn your iPhone back on. Lift your finger from the button once the Apple logo appears on the screen. To force restart your device, hold the Home and Power button until the Apple logo appears. Once the logo appears, immediately release both buttons and wait for the device to reboot. Here are the steps to turn off your iPhone, along with visual aids:

**Step 1: Press and Hold a Side Button**
For iPhones with Face ID (iPhone X and later), press and hold the side button and either the volume up or volume down button simultaneously until the "slide to power off" slider appears.
For iPhones with a Home button, press and hold the side or top button until the "slide to power off" slider appears.
**Step 2: Slide to Power Off**
Drag the "slide to power off" slider from left to right. Your iPhone will then begin the shutdown process.
Wait for your iPhone to completely power down before releasing the buttons. You'll know it's off when the screen goes black.

Turning off your iPhone is a simple process that can be done in a few steps. Here are the steps to turn off your iPhone:

**Visual Steps:**

2. **Press and hold the Sleep/Wake button**: Press and hold the Sleep/Wake button until the power off slider appears on the screen.
3. **Drag the power off slider**: Drag the power off slider to the right to turn off your iPhone.

**Text Steps:**

1. **Locate the Sleep/Wake button**: On the front of your iPhone, you'll see a small button on the top right corner. This is the Sleep/Wake button.
2. **Press and hold the Sleep/Wake button**: Press and hold the Sleep/Wake button until the power off slider appears on the screen.
3. **Drag the power off slider**: Drag the power off slider to the right to turn off your iPhone.

That's it! Your iPhone should now be turned off. If you need to turn it back on, simply press and hold the Sleep/Wake button again until the Apple logo appears on the screen.

prompt: How to add bookmarks in Safari (iPhone)? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Safari app. It's a blue and white app with a compass icon. 2. Go to a web page. Typically, bookmarks are used for web pages you visit frequently or want to remember so you can visit them again in the future. You can enter a website in the address bar or use Google Search to find it. 3. Click Bookmarks in the menu bar. You might also see "Bookmark" at the top of the screen—you can click on that to add your bookmark, as well. [1] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview Alternatively, click the Share button in the top-right corner of the window. 4. Click Add Bookmark… . This is in the drop-down menu. A pop-up window will open. 5. Name the bookmark (optional). You can keep the auto-filled web page name or delete it and give it a name of your choice. 6. Select a location for the bookmark. You'll see a list of available folders under the "Add this page to" drop-down menu. To add a new folder, click Bookmarks in the menu bar, then click Add Bookmark Folder . This will add an "untitled folder" to the sidebar in Safari. Long-click the folder to edit the name. 7. Click Add . This will add the web page to your Mac's bookmarks. To access your bookmarks, click Bookmarks in the menu bar and click on the bookmark you want to open. Click Bookmarks in the menu bar and click Show Bookmarks to display the bookmarks sidebar. Click Bookmarks in the menu bar and click Edit Bookmarks to move, delete, or rename your bookmarks. You can also import bookmarks to Safari .

1. Open Safari on your iPhone.

4. Tap "Add to Bookmarks" from the Share menu.

If you want to access your bookmarks later, you can do so by tapping the Bookmarks button (the star icon) at the bottom of the screen.

prompt: How to update iOS on iPhone? Show steps with screenshots and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Back up your iOS device . [1] X Expert Source Chiara Corsaro Computer Specialist Expert Interview 2. Open Settings. It's a gray app with gears that's typically located on your home screen. 3. Scroll down and tap General . 4. Tap Software Update . It's at the top of the menu. 5. Tap Download and Install or Install Now . If a software update is already downloaded, the Install Now button will appear below the update description. You'll need to accept legal agreements before manually downloading the update. 6. Enter your passcode if prompted. Enter the passcode you use to unlock your phone. Your phone will restart and the update process will begin. In some cases, you may have to set up your phone again, although all your apps and data should be intact.

Gemini_text:
Here's how to update iOS on your iPhone, with screenshots to guide you:

**Step 1: Back up your iPhone.**
Before you begin any software update, it's a good practice to back up your iPhone. You can do this using iCloud or your computer.


**Step 2: Connect to Wi-Fi.**
Ensure your iPhone is connected to a stable Wi-Fi network. Software updates can be quite large, and using cellular data might incur extra charges or be slower.


**Step 3: Go to Settings.**
Open the "Settings" app on your iPhone. It's the icon that looks like gears.


**Step 4: Tap General.**
In the Settings menu, scroll down and tap on "General."
**Step 5: Tap Software Update.**
Within the General settings, tap "Software Update." Your iPhone will then check for available updates.

Bagel_text:
Updating your iPhone to the latest iOS version is a straightforward process that can be done through the Settings app. Here are the steps to update your iPhone:

1. **Open the Settings App**: On your iPhone, find and open the Settings app. It's the one with the gear icon.

2. **Tap on General**: Once the Settings app is open, scroll down and tap on "General."

3. **Tap on Software Update**: In the General settings, you'll see an option for "Software Update." Tap on it.

4. **Check for Updates**: The iPhone will check for any available updates. If there's an update, you'll see a message indicating that an update is available.

5. **Download and Install the Update**: If an update is available, you'll see a button that says "Download and Install." Tap on it. The update will start downloading and installing.

6. **Restart Your iPhone**: After the update is installed, your iPhone will automatically restart. This is necessary for the update to take effect.

7. **Set Up Your iPhone**: After the restart, you'll be prompted to set up your iPhone. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the setup process.

8. **Verify the Update**: Once the setup is complete, you can verify that the update has been successfully installed by going back to the Settings app and checking the version of iOS you're running.

Here are the steps with screenshots:

1. **Open the Settings App**:
   - Image: A screenshot of the Settings app icon.

2. **Tap on General**:
   - Image: A screenshot of the General settings option in the Settings app.

3. **Tap on Software Update**:
   - Image: A screenshot of the Software Update option in the General settings.

4. **Check for Updates**:
   - Image: A screenshot showing the Software Update screen with a message indicating an update is available.

5. **Download and Install the Update**:
   - Image: A screenshot of the Download and Install button.

6. **Restart Your iPhone**:
   - Image: A screenshot of the restart prompt.

7. **Set Up Your iPhone**:
   - Image: A screenshot of the setup process.

8. **Verify the Update**:
   - Image: A screenshot of the Settings app showing the updated version of iOS.

Remember, before updating your iPhone, make sure you have enough storage space and a stable internet connection. It's also a good idea to back up your iPhone to prevent any data loss in case something goes wrong during the update process.

prompt: How to change Apple ID password? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Apple ID website. Go to https://appleid.apple.com/ in your computer's web browser. This is the official website for managing your Apple ID information, including your password. 2. Log into your Apple ID account. Unless you've accessed the Apple ID website in the last 30 minutes, you'll have to log in by entering your Apple ID email address and password in the middle of the page. If you have two-factor authentication enabled for your account, you'll need to verify your login by opening your iPhone, tapping Allow when prompted, and then entering the six-digit code that appears into the text field on your computer. 3. Scroll down to the "Security" section. It's near the top of the page. 4. Click Change Password… . You'll see this option in the "Security" section. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu to appear. 5. Enter your current Apple ID password. In the top text field in the drop-down menu, type in the password you used to log into your Apple ID page. 6. Enter your new password twice. Click the "new password" text box and type in the password you want to use, then click the "confirm password" text box and re-enter your password. The password entries must match each other before you can proceed. Your password needs to have at least 8 characters, and it must include at least one number, one uppercase letter, and one lowercase letter. 7. Click Change Password… . It's at the bottom of the drop-down menu. Doing so will change your Apple ID password.

For security, your iPhone or iPad will ask for your device passcode (the one you use to unlock your phone). Enter it to continue.

Bagel_text:
Changing your Apple ID password is a straightforward process that can be done from your iPhone, iPad, or Mac. Here are the steps to change your Apple ID password:

**Method 1: Change Apple ID password on iPhone or iPad**

1. Open the Settings app on your iPhone or iPad.
2. Tap on your name at the top of the screen.
3. Tap on "Password & Security" (on iOS 15 and later) or "Password" (on iOS 14 and earlier).
4. Tap on "Change Password".
5. Enter your current Apple ID password.
6. Enter a new password and confirm it.
7. Tap "Change Password" to save the changes.

**Method 2: Change Apple ID password on Mac**

1. Open System Preferences on your Mac.
2. Click on "Apple ID" (on macOS Catalina and later) or "Account" (on macOS Mojave and earlier).
3. Click on "Security" in the left sidebar.
4. Click on "Change Password".
5. Enter your current Apple ID password.
6. Enter a new password and confirm it.
7. Click "Change Password" to save the changes.

**Method 3: Change Apple ID password using the Apple ID website**

1. Go to appleid.apple.com and sign in with your Apple ID and password.
2. Click on "Security" in the left sidebar.
3. Click on "Change Password".
4. Enter your current Apple ID password.
5. Enter a new password and confirm it.
6. Click "Change Password" to save the changes.

That's it! Your Apple ID password should now be changed. Remember to keep your new password safe and secure.

prompt: How to create a group chat on WhatsApp? Show illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the WhatsApp app. If you don't already have it, WhatsApp for iPhone is free to download from the App Store . If you can't find WhatsApp on your iPhone, swipe down from the middle of the screen and type "WhatsApp" into the ensuing search bar. You should see WhatsApp's icon pop up at the top of this menu. 2. Tap the "Chats" option to open your chat history. This is in the toolbar at the bottom of the screen. If WhatsApp opens to your last-used chat, you'll need to tap the "Chats" option in the top left corner to return to the Chats menu. 3. Tap + . This is in the top-right corner. You will need to have at least one chat in your Chats menu before you can create a group; if you've only just installed WhatsApp, simply send a one-word chat to a contact in order to activate the "New Group" option. 4. Tap New Group . This is at the top. 5. Select contacts and tap Next . Tap the contacts from the list. If you're trying to invite a contact that doesn't have a WhatsApp account, you'll need to invite them via SMS. You can have up to 1024 members in one group. 6. Enter group details. You can add a group name and group icon. You can also change the group settings. The group name must be under 100 characters. To add a group icon, tap the camera icon and select Take Photo , Choose Photo , Emoji & Stickers , or Search Web . Tap Disappearing messages to toggle it on. Tap Group permissions to change additional settings. 7. Tap Create . This will create your group.

Gemini_text:
Here's how to create a group chat on WhatsApp, with illustrated steps:

1.  **Open WhatsApp and Tap the New Chat Icon:**
    First, open the WhatsApp application on your smartphone. Look for the "New Chat" icon, which is usually a speech bubble or a pencil icon, located in the bottom right corner (on Android) or top right (on iOS) of the main chat screen.
    2.  **Select "New Group":**
    After tapping the new chat icon, you'll see a list of your contacts and an option at the top to create a "New Group." Tap on this option to proceed.
    3.  **Add Participants:**
    Now you can start adding people to your group. Scroll through your contacts or use the search bar to find the friends, family, or colleagues you want to include. Tap on each contact's name to select them. Once you've selected everyone, tap the green arrow button to continue.
    4.  **Enter Group Subject and Add Icon (Optional):**
    Give your group a name or "subject" so everyone knows what the chat is about. You can also tap the camera icon to add a group photo, which makes it easier to identify the group in your chat list. When you're done, tap the checkmark button (on Android) or "Create" (on iOS).

Bagel_text:
Creating a group chat on WhatsApp is a straightforward process. Here are the illustrated steps to create a group chat on WhatsApp:

**Illustrated Steps:**

**Step 1: Open WhatsApp**
Open the WhatsApp app on your device.

**Step 2: Tap the Chats Icon**
Tap the Chats icon at the bottom of the screen.

**Step 3: Tap the Plus Icon**
Tap the Plus icon (+) at the top right corner of the screen.

**Step 4: Select "New Group"**
Select "New Group" from the options.

**Step 5: Enter Group Name and Photo (Optional)**
Enter a name for your group and add a photo (optional).

**Step 6: Add Contacts**
Tap "Add Contacts" and select the contacts you want to add to the group.

**Step 7: Set Group Type**
Select the group type (e.g., "Private" or "Public").

**Step 8: Tap "Create"**
Tap "Create" to create the group.

**Text Steps:**

1. Open WhatsApp on your device.
2. Tap the Chats icon at the bottom of the screen.
3. Tap the Plus icon (+) at the top right corner of the screen.
4. Select "New Group" from the options.
5. Enter a name for your group and add a photo (optional).
6. Tap "Add Contacts" and select the contacts you want to add to the group.
7. Select the group type (e.g., "Private" or "Public").
8. Tap "Create" to create the group.

That's it! You have successfully created a group chat on WhatsApp.

prompt: How to Share Your Live Location on WhatsApp? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the WhatsApp app. It's a green app with a white phone icon on it. WhatsApp is available for iOS in the App Store . Set up WhatsApp if you haven't done so already. 2. Tap the Chats tab. This option is at the bottom of the screen, between Camera and Settings . You can select a conversation from here. If WhatsApp opens to a conversation, first tap the "Back" button in the top-left corner of the screen. 3. Tap a conversation. Doing so will open the conversation with the corresponding contact. You can also tap the "New Message" icon in the top-right corner of the Chats page to create a new message, or you can search for messages . 4. Tap + . It's in the bottom-left corner of the screen. This will open a pop-up menu. 5. Tap Location . This option is near the bottom of the pop-up menu, underneath Document . If this is your first time sharing your location, you may need to allow permissions. Select Once , While Using This App , or Always . If you want to share your location for a long period of time, select Always . 6. Tap Send Your Current Location . It's below the map at the top of the screen. You'll also see a list of nearby establishments such as parks, schools, and stores that you can send instead. WhatsApp will send a map with a red pin indicating your location. Your recipient may tap the "Share" arrow in the bottom-left corner of the screen and then tap Open in Maps to receive directions. If you want to share your location for a period of time, tap Share Live Location located at the top of the listing. Select 15 Minutes, 1 Hour, or 8 Hours, then tap the blue arrow. If you want to stop sharing, return to the chat log and tap Stop Sharing on the map. 7. Open the WhatsApp app. It's the green app with a white phone icon on it. If you aren't logged in, enter your phone number to do so now. WhatsApp is available for Android in the Google Play Store . 8. Tap the Chats tab. This option is in the top-left corner of the screen. You'll see a list of your existing chat conversations appear. If WhatsApp opens to a conversation, first tap the "Back" button in the top-left corner of the screen. 9. Tap a conversation. Doing so will open the conversation with the corresponding contact. You can also tap the green "New Message" icon in the bottom-right corner of the "Chats" page and then select a contact to create a new message. If you create a group with trusted users, you'll be able to share your location with multiple people at once. 10. Tap the paperclip icon. It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen, within the message field. 11. Tap Location . This will be underneath the green pinpoint icon. If this is your first time sharing your location, you may need to allow permissions. Select All the time , Only while using the app , or Ask every time . If you want to share your location for a long period of time, select All the time . 12. Tap Send your current location . It's just below the map that's near the top of the screen. You'll also see a list of nearby establishments such as parks, schools, and stores that you can send instead. WhatsApp will send a map with a red pin indicating your location. Your recipient may tap the "Share" arrow in the bottom-left corner of the screen and then tap Open in Maps to receive directions. If you want to share your location for a period of time, tap Share Live Location located at the top of the listing. Select 15 Minutes, 1 Hour, or 8 Hours, then tap the green arrow. If you want to stop sharing, return to the chat log and tap Stop Sharing on the map.

text_rubrics.criterion: The answer must provide distinct instructions for both iOS and Android, acknowledging the different UI elements used to access attachments (e.g., '+' icon vs. paperclip icon).
The answer must clearly differentiate between 'Share Live Location' and 'Send Your Current Location,' and the steps must guide the user to select the 'Live Location' option.
The instructions must mention the step of selecting a duration for sharing the live location (e.g., 15 minutes, 1 hour, or 8 hours).
To address the 'visual steps' requirement, the text must describe the appearance and on-screen location of key buttons and icons involved in the process.
The answer must present the process as a clear, sequential list of actionable steps, starting from opening the app and navigating to a chat.
A comprehensive answer should include how to handle the initial location permission request from the app.

When the user's question specifies a particular option (e.g., 'Share Live Location'), the final instructional image should visually highlight that specific choice, even if other options are available and mentioned in the text.

Gemini_text:
I can help you with that! Sharing your live location on WhatsApp is a useful feature for letting friends and family know where you are in real-time. Here are the steps:

**Step 1: Open a Chat and Tap the Attach Icon**
First, open the individual or group chat where you want to share your live location. Then, tap on the paperclip-shaped "Attach" icon (on Android) or the "+" icon (on iPhone) next to the message input field.
**Step 2: Select 'Location'**
From the menu that appears, tap on "Location." You may need to grant WhatsApp location permissions if you haven't already.
**Step 3: Tap 'Share Live Location'**
You'll see an option for "Share Live Location." Tap on this to proceed.
**Step 4: Choose Duration and Add a Comment**
WhatsApp will ask you to choose how long you want to share your live location (e.g., 15 minutes, 1 hour, or 8 hours). Select your desired duration, and you can also add a comment if you like. Finally, tap the "Send" icon.
Once sent, the recipients in the chat will be able to see your live location on a map for the duration you selected. You can stop sharing at any time by tapping "Stop Sharing" in the chat.

Bagel_text:
Sharing your live location on WhatsApp is a great way to keep your friends and family updated on your whereabouts. Here are the steps to do so:

**Text Steps:**

1. Open WhatsApp on your phone.
2. Tap on the three dots at the top right corner of the screen.
3. Tap on "New Group" or "New Broadcast" depending on whether you want to share your location with a group or a single person.
4. Tap on the "Location" button at the bottom of the screen.
5. Tap on "Live Location" to share your live location.
6. Choose the duration for which you want to share your location (e.g., 15 minutes, 1 hour, or indefinitely).
7. Tap "Send" to share your live location.

**Visual Steps:**

1. Open WhatsApp on your phone.
2. Tap on the three dots at the top right corner of the screen.
3. Tap on "New Group" or "New Broadcast" depending on whether you want to share your location with a group or a single person.
4. Tap on the "Location" button at the bottom of the screen.
5. Tap on "Live Location" to share your live location.
6. Choose the duration for which you want to share your location (e.g., 15 minutes, 1 hour, or indefinitely).
7. Tap "Send" to share your live location.

That's it! Your friends and family will be able to see your live location on WhatsApp.

prompt: How to Add Contacts to Your Phone via WhatsApp? Show screenshot steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open WhatsApp and tap the speech bubble icon. You’ll find this icon in the bottom right corner of the screen in the Chats tab once you open WhatsApp. If the app opens to a conversation, tap ← in the top left corner of the screen to go back to the Chats tab before looking for the speech bubble. You’ll need to set up WhatsApp if it’s your first time opening it. 2. Tap New contact . It's at the top of your Contacts menu next to an icon that resembles a person. Doing so will take you to the new contact creation page. If asked to select an app, tap the Contacts app and tap Always. If you have multiple Google accounts on your phone, select the one you want to add a contact to. 3. Type in the person's contact information. Enter their name in the "First Name" and "Last "Name" fields near the top of the screen. Then, tap the "Phone" field (located beneath the "Organization" field) and type in your new contact’s phone number. If the number is from a different country, you may need to add a country code (e.g., "1" for the U.S. or "44" for the U.K.) in addition to the standard 10 digits. 4. Tap the Save button to finalize the entry. It's in the top right corner of the screen. Doing so will save the contact’s information in WhatsApp, and you’ll be able to contact them from within the app. If you want to sync this contact with your phone's Contacts app, you can also tap the Sync contact to phone option.

Here are the steps to add contacts to your phone via WhatsApp:

**Step 1:** Open WhatsApp and tap on the chat icon in the bottom right corner.
 **Step 2:** Tap on "New contact."
 **Step 3:** Enter the contact's name and phone number.
 **Step 4:** Tap "Save." The contact will be added to your phone's address book and will appear in your WhatsApp contacts.

Bagel_text:
Adding contacts to your phone via WhatsApp is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to do it:

1. Open WhatsApp on your phone.
2. Tap on the three dots at the top right corner of the screen.
3. Tap on "Contacts" from the dropdown menu.
4. Tap on "Add Contacts" from the next screen.
5. Choose how you want to add contacts. You can choose from "Contacts from Phone" or "Contacts from WhatsApp".
6. If you choose "Contacts from Phone", WhatsApp will automatically sync your phone's contacts with WhatsApp.
7. If you choose "Contacts from WhatsApp", you can manually add contacts by tapping on the "+" icon at the top right corner of the screen.
8. Enter the contact's name and phone number, and tap on "Save".
9. Repeat steps 7-8 for each contact you want to add.
10. Once you have added all the contacts, tap on "Save" at the top right corner of the screen.

Here is a screenshot of the steps:

prompt: How to Hide Your Phone Number on WhatsApp? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Download the Google Voice app. Although it's not possible to hide your real phone number in WhatsApp, you can keep it private by replacing it with one nobody knows. Google Voice lets you create a brand new number for free. To download the app: Open the Play Store or App Store . Tap the search bar or magnifying glass. Type google voice and tap ↵ Enter or Search . Tap Google Voice . Tap INSTALL or GET . Follow the on-screen instructions to download and install the app. Note that Google Voice is not available in the UK, Canada, or Europe unless you use a VPN that assigns you a US-based IP address . 2. Sign into your Google account. Open the app and follow the on-screen instructions to enter your login information. Your Google Voice phone number will be connected to the account you use to sign in. But don't worry if you're trying to protect your identity--nobody (other than law enforcement and people at Google) can trace your new phone number back to your Google account. 3. Read the terms and tap CONTINUE . 4. Tap SEARCH . 5. Select a location for your new phone number. You can choose a number by city or area code. If you aren't finding any numbers in your area, try a nearby city or area code. 6. Tap Select next to the phone number you want. Additional instructions for setting up your new phone number will appear. 7. Follow the on-screen instructions to verify your new number. Now that you've set up a Google Voice phone number, see Changing Your WhatsApp Number on Android or Changing Your WhatsApp Number on iPhone or iPad . You'll be given the option to forward your Google Voice phone number to your regular number. If you don't want people on WhatsApp to ring your phone, don't choose this option.

Gemini_text:
Here's a step-by-step guide on how to hide your phone number on WhatsApp:

**Step 1: Open WhatsApp and Go to Settings**

Launch the WhatsApp application on your smartphone. Once it's open, navigate to the 'Settings' menu. On Android, you usually find this by tapping the three vertical dots in the top right corner. On iPhone, 'Settings' is typically a gear icon at the bottom right.



**Step 2: Tap on 'Account'**

Within the 'Settings' menu, you'll see several options. Look for and tap on 'Account'. This is where you manage your privacy, security, and number settings.



**Step 3: Go to 'Privacy'**

In the 'Account' section, select 'Privacy'. This is where you can control who sees your personal information, including your 'Last Seen', 'Profile Photo', 'About', and 'Groups'.



**Step 4: Tap on 'About'**

Under 'Privacy', find and tap on the 'About' option. Your phone number is linked to your 'About' information, as it's part of your profile details.



**Step 5: Choose 'Nobody'**

You'll be presented with options: 'Everyone', 'My contacts', and 'Nobody'. To effectively hide your phone number from others who are not in your contacts or from everyone, select 'Nobody'. This will ensure that only the people you've specifically allowed (or no one at all) can see your information.

prompt: How to turn off notifications on Instagram? Show visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open your iPhone's Settings . Tap the grey app with gears on it. This app is typically found on the Home Screen. 2. Tap Notifications . It's near the top of the menu. Doing so opens a list of all apps that currently support notifications. 3. Scroll down and tap Instagram . Apps here are listed alphabetically, so you'll find Instagram in the "I" section. If Instagram is not appearing, you may need to wait until you've received a notification from someone. If Instagram is still not appearing in the list, even after receiving a notification in the app, uninstall the Instagram app, restart your phone, and then install it again. When you launch the reinstalled app, select Allow Notifications when prompted, and Instagram should appear in the Notifications section of the Settings app. 4. Tap the white "Allow Notifications" switch . It's at the top of the screen. Tapping it will cause it to turn green , signifying that Instagram will send notifications to your iPhone. If you want to disable Instagram notifications completely, tap the green "Allow Notifications" switch and then skip the rest of this method. 5. Enable or disable other notifications. Tap the white switch to the right of each of the following options to enable them, or tap the green switch next to each of them to disable them: Sounds - Turn on or off Instagram sounds. Badge App Icon - Turn on or off Instagram badge icons, which are the numbers that display in the corner of the Instagram app when you have pending notifications. Show on Lock Screen - Turn on or off notifications that appear on your iPhone's Lock Screen. Show in History - Turn on or off notifications history for Instagram. Notifications history can be checked by swiping down from the top of the screen. Show as Banners - Turn on or off banner-style notifications, which display at the top of the screen when your iPhone is unlocked. 6. Select an alert style. Below the "Show as Banners" switch, tap either Temporary or Persistent . This option won't display if you have "Show as Banners" turned off. "Temporary" alerts appear briefly at the top of your iPhone's screen before disappearing, while "Persistent" alerts don't disappear until you swipe them away. 7. Set a preview option. This will determine whether or not you can see the content of an Instagram notification without opening it. Scroll down and tap Show Previews , then select one of the following options: Always (Default) - You will always see previews for Instagram notifications (e.g., "Sarah liked your post"). When Unlocked - You will see previews for Instagram notifications when your iPhone is unlocked. Never - You will never see previews for Instagram notifications. 8. Tap the "Back" button twice. It's in the top-left corner of the screen. This will take you back to the Notifications page, saving your changes in the process. Instagram will now send you notifications.

**Step 1: Open Instagram and Go to Your Profile**
First, open the Instagram app on your phone. Then, tap on your profile picture in the bottom right corner of the screen to go to your profile. **Step 2: Access Settings**
On your profile page, tap the three horizontal lines (hamburger menu) in the top right corner. This will open a side menu. From there, select "Settings." **Step 3: Go to Notifications**
In the Settings menu, you'll see an option called "Notifications." Tap on this to manage your notification preferences. **Step 4: Pause All Notifications**
At the top of the Notifications screen, you'll see a toggle switch for "Pause All." Turn this on to temporarily disable all Instagram notifications. You can choose how long to pause them (e.g., 15 minutes, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, or 8 hours).

Bagel_text:
To turn off notifications on Instagram, follow these steps:

**Method 1: Using the Instagram App**

1. Open the Instagram app on your device.
2. Tap on the profile icon in the bottom right corner of the screen.
3. Tap on the three horizontal lines in the top right corner of the screen to open the menu.
4. Tap on "Settings" at the bottom of the menu.
5. Tap on "Notifications" in the settings menu.
6. Toggle off the notifications you want to turn off. You can toggle off all notifications by tapping on "All" and then tapping on "Turn off all notifications."

**Method 2: Using a Web Browser**

1. Open a web browser on your device and go to the Instagram website (www.instagram.com).
2. Log in to your Instagram account if you haven't already.
3. Click on your profile picture in the top right corner of the screen.
4. Click on "Settings" in the dropdown menu.
5. Click on "Notifications" in the settings menu.
6. Toggle off the notifications you want to turn off. You can toggle off all notifications by clicking on "All" and then clicking on "Turn off all notifications."

**Method 3: Using the Instagram App on a Computer**

1. Open the Instagram app on your computer.
2. Click on your profile picture in the top right corner of the screen.
3. Click on "Settings" in the dropdown menu.
4. Click on "Notifications" in the settings menu.
5. Toggle off the notifications you want to turn off. You can toggle off all notifications by clicking on "All" and then clicking on "Turn off all notifications."

That's it! You should now have turned off your Instagram notifications.

Bagel_text:
Yes, you can log into Instagram on a computer. Here are the steps to do so:

**Method 1: Using a Web Browser**

1. Open a web browser on your computer (e.g., Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Safari, etc.).
2. Go to the Instagram website ([www.instagram.com](http://www.instagram.com)) in the browser.
3. Click on the "Log In" button in the top right corner of the page.
4. Enter your Instagram username and password in the respective fields.
5. Click on the "Log In" button to log into your Instagram account.

**Method 2: Using the Instagram Desktop App**

1. Download and install the Instagram desktop app on your computer (if you haven't already).
2. Open the Instagram desktop app on your computer.
3. Click on the "Log In" button in the top right corner of the app.
4. Enter your Instagram username and password in the respective fields.
5. Click on the "Log In" button to log into your Instagram account.

**Visual Steps:**

1. Open a web browser on your computer.
2. Go to the Instagram website ([www.instagram.com](http://www.instagram.com)) in the browser.
3. Click on the "Log In" button in the top right corner of the page.
4. Enter your Instagram username and password in the respective fields.
5. Click on the "Log In" button to log into your Instagram account.

**Method 2: Using the Instagram Desktop App**

1. Download and install the Instagram desktop app on your computer.
2. Open the Instagram desktop app on your computer.
3. Click on the "Log In" button in the top right corner of the app.
4. Enter your Instagram username and password in the respective fields.
5. Click on the "Log In" button to log into your Instagram account.

That's it! You should now be logged into your Instagram account on your computer.

prompt: How to log out of Facebook on mobile? Show illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Facebook app . This looks like a white f with a blue background. Facebook is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . 2. Tap ☰ . On iOS, you can find this in the bottom-right corner. On Android, this will be in the top-right corner. 3. Scroll down and tap Log out . This is the grey button at the very bottom of the page. You may be asked to save your login information. Tap Not now or Save . 4. Tap Log out to confirm. This will log you out of the Facebook app and return you to the app's login screen. This is different from deactivating your account , which hides your profile and limits your activity. If you're having trouble logging out, restart your device and try again.

prompt: How to add a bookmark in Chrome? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Add a bookmark. With the Chrome desktop browser, you can add, edit, sort, and delete bookmarks. If you don't have automatic updates enabled, make sure to update Chrome to the latest version. Open Google Chrome. Navigate to a webpage you want to bookmark. Click the star icon on the right side of the address bar. Click Done . 2. Find your bookmarks. If you don't see your bookmarks bar underneath the address bar, do the following to find your bookmarks: Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. Hover over Bookmarks and lists . Click Show bookmarks bar to enable it or Bookmark Manager to see all bookmarks in a window. 3. Edit a bookmark. If you want to change the name or location of your bookmark, do the following: Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. Hover over Bookmarks and lists . Click Bookmark Manager . Click ⋮ on the right of a bookmark Click Edit . Enter a new name, or click the drop-down menu to select a new location. 4. Delete a bookmark. If you don't want a bookmark anymore, you can delete it from the bookmark bar or Bookmark Manager. Right-click the bookmark in the bookmark bar and click Delete . Alternatively, do the following: Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. Hover over Bookmarks and lists . Click Bookmark Manager . Click ⋮ on the right of a bookmark Click Delete . 5. Create a folder for your bookmarks. Folders can be used to sort your bookmarks for easier navigation. Do the following: Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. Hover over Bookmarks and lists . Click Bookmark Manager . Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. Click Add new folder . Enter a name and click Save . 6. Sort your bookmarks. Chrome can automatically sort your bookmarks by name. Keep in mind that this will also change its order in your bookmarks bar. Do the following: Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. Hover over Bookmarks and lists . Click Bookmark Manager . Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. Click Sort by name . 7. Move your bookmarks. You can reorder your bookmarks in any way you'd like. Click and drag the bookmark on your bookmarks bar, or do the following: Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. Hover over Bookmarks and lists . Click Bookmark Manager . Click and drag a bookmark up or down or reorder it. You can also drag a bookmark into another folder.

prompt: How to Reset Your Router Password? Show illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Power on your Netgear router and wait approximately one minute for the router to boot up. 2. Locate the “Restore Factory Settings” button on your router, which is enclosed in a red circle and labeled accordingly. 3. Press and hold the “Restore Factory Settings” button for about seven seconds using a small, thin object such as the end of a paperclip or pen. [2] X Expert Source Stan Kats Cybersecurity Expert Expert Interview 4. Release the button when the “Power” light starts blinking, then allow the router to fully restart. The router password will be reset when the Power light stops blinking and turns solid green or white. The new default router password is “password.”

text_rubrics.criterion: The answer must present the reset process in a chronological sequence, including the key actions of locating the reset button, pressing and holding it for several seconds with a pointed object, and then releasing it.
The answer must mention using the router's indicator lights as feedback to know when to release the button and to confirm the reset is complete.
The answer must clearly state that the result is a full factory reset, which reverts the password and all other settings to their default state.

The answer must provide information on the new default password, either by stating a common default (like 'password' or 'admin') or by instructing the user on how to find it (e.g., on a sticker on the router).

Any annotations or overlays on the images, such as text or timers (e.g., '7 sec.'), must directly correspond to quantitative details provided in the text.
The sequence of images must not include steps or outcomes (e.g., a software login screen) that are not described in the accompanying text instructions.

Gemini_text:
Resetting your router's password can usually be done in a few simple steps. Here’s a general guide:

**Step 1: Locate the Reset Button**
First, you'll need to find the reset button on your router. It's usually a small, recessed button that you might need a paperclip or pen to press. It's often labeled "Reset."

**Step 2: Power On Your Router**
Make sure your router is plugged in and powered on.

**Step 3: Press and Hold the Reset Button**
Using a paperclip or a similar pointed object, press and hold the reset button for about 10-30 seconds. You'll typically see the lights on the router flash or change color, indicating that it's resetting.

**Step 4: Release the Button and Wait**
Release the button and wait for your router to fully restart. This might take a few minutes as it reloads its default settings.

Bagel_text:
Resetting your router password is a simple process that can be done in a few steps. Here are the illustrated steps to reset your router password:

**Step 1: Identify Your Router's IP Address**

* Check your router's label or documentation to find the IP address. It's usually printed on the bottom or back of the router.
* Common IP addresses for routers are 192.168.0.1, 192.168.1.1, or 192.168.2.1.

**Step 2: Open a Web Browser**

* Open a web browser on your computer or mobile device.
* Type the router's IP address in the address bar (e.g., 192.168.0.1) and press Enter.

**Step 3: Log In to Your Router**

* You'll be prompted to enter your router's username and password. The default username and password are usually printed on the router's label or documentation.
* If you've forgotten your password, you can try resetting it to the default password (usually "admin" or "password").

**Step 4: Access the Router's Configuration Page**

* Once you're logged in, look for the "Administration" or "Settings" section.
* Find the "Password" or "Login" section and click on it.

**Step 5: Reset the Router Password**

* Look for a "Reset Password" or "Change Password" option.
* Click on it and enter a new password.
* Confirm the new password and click "Save" or "Apply" to save the changes.

**Step 6: Reboot Your Router**

* After resetting the password, you'll need to reboot your router to apply the changes.
* Unplug the power cord from your router for 30 seconds, then plug it back in.
* Wait for the router to restart and reconnect to your network.

That's it! Your router password has been reset. Remember to write down the new password and keep it safe, as you'll need it to log in to your router in the future.

prompt: How to update WhatsApp on Android? Show visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Play Store . You’ll usually find it on your Android's home screen or in the app drawer. If your Android is not set to update apps automatically, WhatsApp won't update until you check for updates manually. You can use this method to update WhatsApp in this situation. 2. Tap the Search tab. On phones, it's the third tab at bottom of screen, and on tablet, it's the third tab at left. 3. Type whatsapp into the search bar. It’s at the top of the screen. 4. Tap WhatsApp Messenger . It has a green chat bubble icon with a phone receiver inside. Alternatively, tap your profile icon > Manage apps and devices > Manage > WhatsApp . 5. Tap Update . It’s the blue button next to Uninstall . The latest version of WhatsApp will now download and install on your Android. If the blue button does not say Update , you are already using the latest version of WhatsApp. If you know you're running an older version of WhatsApp, you can try downloading the APK file to force an update instead. Otherwise, see our troubleshooting method. 6. Enable automatic updates (optional). If you want to make sure you always have the latest version of WhatsApp on your Android, you can enable automatic updates in the Play Store. Here's how: Tap your profile icon at the top-right corner of the Play Store. Tap Settings . Tap Network Preferences . Tap Auto-update apps . Select Update over Wi-Fi only . We recommend this option so you don't have updates installing in the background when you're using mobile data. If you have unlimited mobile data and don't mind using it to update apps, you can select Update with limited amount of mobile data (to still conserve some data) or Update all apps over Wi-Fi or mobile data . 7. Allow unknown apps on Android. In most cases, you should only need to use this method to update WhatsApp if you installed it from an APK file. Before you can download any APK files, you must enable the setting to sideload apps through your web browser. The steps may vary depending on your phone or tablet. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap Apps or Apps & Notifications . Scroll down or tap the three-dots icon. Tap Special access or Special app access . Tap Install unknown apps . Tap your mobile browser. Toggle on Allow from this source . 8. Go to the WhatsApp download page for Android. Use your mobile browser to visit the link. 9. Tap Download WhatsApp directly . This is below the Google Play button. If prompted, tap OK or Download anyway to bypass the warning. 10. Tap the WhatsApp file. You can find this in the Downloads section of your browser or in your file manager. 11. Tap Install . WhatsApp will begin downloading on your device. When the installation is complete, you'll have the most up-to-date version of WhatsApp. Once WhatsApp has been installed, tap it to open it. If it loads properly, be sure to delete the APK file since this can take up extra space. If you're still having trouble, see the troubleshooting section. 12. Make sure you have enough space. If your Android phone or tablet is almost at max capacity, you may not have enough space to update WhatsApp. Check your storage in your settings. If you're almost out of space, try transferring your photos and videos to a cloud service such as Google Photos or Drive . 13. Check if your device is compatible. If you have an older Android device, it may not be compatible with newer WhatsApp updates. WhatsApp will only work on Android devices that have Android 5.0 or newer and can receive SMS messages or calls. You can check your Android version in Settings > About phone/tablet > Android version . 14. Check if WhatsApp is available in your location. If you're getting this error code, you may have your device set to the wrong region. If it's set to the correct region, WhatsApp isn't currently available for you. To check your region, do the following: Open the Google Play Store . Tap your profile icon. Go to Settings > General > Account and device preferences > Country and profiles . Select the country. 15. Try updating WhatsApp using Wi-Fi. If you're trying to update WhatsApp using cellular data, it may not be strong enough to properly download the update. Connect to Wi-Fi and try updating from the Google Play Store again. 16. Delete the app fully and download it again. If you can't update WhatsApp, try completely deleting the app first. Then, download it again from the Google Play Store. 17. Clear the Google Play Store cache. This can help fix issues, including apps that won't update, by clearing any corrupted data. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap Apps & notifications . Tap See all apps . Tap Google Play Store . Tap Storage . Tap Clear Cache . Tap Clear data . Open the Google Play Store and try downloading WhatsApp again.

text_rubrics.criterion: The answer must provide a clear, step-by-step guide on how to update WhatsApp using the primary method, which is through the Google Play Store.
The text should describe specific User Interface (UI) elements, such as the appearance of buttons or icons, to help the user visually locate them on their screen.

Gemini_text:
Here's how to update WhatsApp on Android:

1.  **Open the Google Play Store app.** You can usually find this on your home screen or in your app drawer.
 
2.  **Tap on your profile icon** (usually a circle with your initial or picture) in the top right corner of the screen.
 
3.  From the menu that appears, tap on **"Manage apps & device."**
 
4.  You'll see an "Updates available" section if there are apps needing updates. Tap on **"See details"** or scroll down to find WhatsApp in the list.
 
5.  Once you find WhatsApp, tap the **"Update"** button next to it. If it's not listed, your WhatsApp is already up to date.

Bagel_text:
Updating WhatsApp on Android is a straightforward process that ensures you have the latest features and security patches. Here’s a step-by-step guide with visual aids to help you update WhatsApp on your Android device:

### Step-by-Step Guide to Update WhatsApp on Android

#### Step 1: Open the Google Play Store
- **Visual Aid:** A screenshot of the Google Play Store app on your Android device.
- **Text:** Open the Google Play Store app on your Android device.

#### Step 2: Search for WhatsApp
- **Visual Aid:** A screenshot of the search bar within the Google Play Store with "WhatsApp" typed in.
- **Text:** Tap on the search bar at the top of the Google Play Store and type "WhatsApp."

#### Step 3: Select WhatsApp Messenger
- **Visual Aid:** A screenshot of the search results with WhatsApp Messenger highlighted.
- **Text:** Tap on the "WhatsApp Messenger" app from the search results.

#### Step 4: Tap on the "Update" Button
- **Visual Aid:** A screenshot of the WhatsApp Messenger page with the "Update" button highlighted.
- **Text:** Tap on the "Update" button next to the WhatsApp Messenger app.

#### Step 5: Wait for the Update to Complete
- **Visual Aid:** A screenshot showing the update in progress with a progress bar.
- **Text:** Wait for the update to complete. This may take a few seconds to a few minutes depending on your internet connection and the size of the update.

#### Step 6: Open WhatsApp
- **Visual Aid:** A screenshot of the WhatsApp Messenger app icon on your home screen.
- **Text:** Once the update is complete, tap on the WhatsApp Messenger app icon to open it.

### Additional Tips
- **Automatic Updates:** If you have automatic updates enabled, WhatsApp will update automatically without you needing to do anything.
- **Check Storage:** Before updating, make sure you have enough storage space on your device. WhatsApp can take up a significant amount of space, especially if you have many media files stored within the app.
- **Update Regularly:** Regularly updating WhatsApp ensures you have the latest security patches and features, which can improve the overall performance and security of the app.

By following these steps, you should be able to update WhatsApp on your Android device successfully.

prompt: How to Add a Photo to Your Google Site? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open your Google Sites page. Go to https://sites.google.com/ in your browser and select your site. If your site was previously a Google Classic site, it will automatically change to a newer site. 2. Select a page that you want to add an image to. Click one of the page titles (e.g., Contact Us ) at the top of the page under the Pages tab. Depending on your chosen site layout, these page titles may be elsewhere. 3. Click the INSERT tab. It's in the upper-right corner of the page. 4. Click Images . It looks like a red icon of a photo next to Text Box. Clicking it will prompt a menu to drop down. 5. Click Upload . This is usually the first option in the menu. A File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac) window will open. If you want to use a photo from Google Drive instead, click Images in the "INSERT" tab, then click Select , choose an image to use, and click Insert . Skip ahead to the "Adjust your photo's position" step. If you want to add an image carousel instead, click Image carousel . That feature allows you to upload multiple images that will display one at a time and change automatically. 6. Double-click a photo you want to use on your site. You can also click once, then click Open to add it to your site. 7. Adjust your photo's position. Click and drag your photo around the page until it's positioned how you want it. You can also resize the photo by clicking and dragging one of its corners inward or outward. You can also add a link to the photo by clicking the photo to select it, clicking the chainlink-shaped "Link" icon in the grey bar that appears, entering a URL, and clicking APPLY . 8. Preview your page. Click the monitor and computer screen icon at the top of the page. This will show you your site as it will appear on different screens when published. You can also select different screen types (e.g., tablets or phones) by clicking the appropriate screen shape in the lower-right corner of the page. This will ensure that you know how your site will appear on mobile as well as on desktop. 9. Publish your changes. Click the X on the bottom-right side of the screen to close the preview, then click PUBLISH in the top-right corner. This will save your changes and publish them to the live version of your site. You can also drag and drop an image file from Finder (Mac) or File Explorer (Windows) into the site's editing dashboard to quickly upload photos.

Gemini_text:
Here's how to add a photo to your Google Site, with visual aids for each step:

**Step 1: Open Your Google Site and Select the Desired Page**
First, go to [sites.google.com](https://sites.google.com/) and open the Google Site you wish to edit. Once your site is open, navigate to the specific page where you want to add the image. You can do this using the "Pages" tab on the right-hand sidebar.
**Step 2: Insert Image**
On the right-hand sidebar, click on the "Insert" tab. Then, choose either "Images" to upload a new image from your computer or "Embed URL" if your image is hosted online. For this example, we'll choose "Images."
**Step 3: Upload Image**
After clicking "Images," you'll see options to "Upload" or "Select image." If you click "Upload," a file explorer window will open. Navigate to the image you want to add on your computer, select it, and click "Open."
**Step 4: Image Placed on Site**
Your image will now appear on your Google Site page. You can click and drag it to reposition it, or use the handles around the image to resize it. You'll also see a toolbar appear above the image with options to crop, uncrop, add a link, or delete the image.

Bagel_text:
Adding a photo to your Google Site is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to follow:

**Step 1: Log in to your Google Account**
Open your web browser and go to the Google Sites website. Log in to your Google account if you haven't already.

**Step 2: Create or Edit a Page**
If you haven't created a page yet, click on the "Create a new page" button. If you have an existing page, click on the page you want to add the photo to.

**Step 3: Click on the "Insert" Icon**
In the top toolbar, click on the "Insert" icon (it looks like a plus sign with a circle around it).

**Step 4: Select "Image"**
In the dropdown menu that appears, select "Image".

**Step 5: Upload Your Photo**
Click on the "Upload" button to select a photo from your computer. You can also drag and drop a photo from your computer into the box.

**Step 6: Adjust the Photo**
Once you've uploaded your photo, you can adjust its size and position by dragging the corners or edges of the photo. You can also add a caption by clicking on the "Caption" button.

**Step 7: Save Your Changes**
Click on the "Save" button to save your changes. Your photo should now be added to your Google Site.

Here's a visual representation of the steps:

1. Log in to your Google Account
2. Create or Edit a Page
3. Click on the "Insert" Icon
4. Select "Image"
5. Upload Your Photo
6. Adjust the Photo
7. Save Your Changes

That's it! Your photo should now be added to your Google Site.

prompt: How to change screen timeout on Android? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open your Android's Settings . You can get there by tapping the gear-shaped icon in your Apps list. Alternatively, you can also find the Settings menu by swiping down from the top of the screen and tapping the icon that resembles a gear. This method works for all models of Android, including Samsung, LG, and Google Pixel. 2. Tap Display . You should see this option on most Androids, although some models have varying language on their menus. 3. Tap Screen timeout . If you're using a Samsung model, you'll usually find this at the bottom of the menu. If you're using a recent Pixel model or another brand, you may have to tap Advanced and then Screen timeout or Sleep instead. If you are having a hard time finding this option, tap the magnifying glass icon in the upper-right corner of the Settings menu. Then type "Screen Timeout" or "Sleep" in the search bar. 4. Choose how long your phone screen should stay on when idle. Tap the radio option next to the time you want your phone or tablet to wait before your phone screen times out. The smallest option is 15 seconds , which conserves the least amount of battery power. The largest option, 30 minutes , will consume the most. Once you tap your selection, it will take effect immediately. Some phones have fewer options from which to choose. For example, some Androids won't let you choose a timeout length longer than 5 minutes. Newer Samsung models have a "keep screen on while viewing" toggle. Tap that to enable it so your screen doesn't turn off while the front camera detects your face. If you're using an older Samsung phone with Smart Stay enabled, your phone's screen will stay illuminated as long as you are looking at the screen regardless of what you select here. Continue reading to customize your Smart Stay settings on some Samsung Galaxy phones and tablets. 5. Open up your Samsung Galaxy's Settings . It's the gear-shaped icon in your apps list. Some older Samsung Galaxy phones and tablets, like the Galaxy Note 2, have the option of enabling Smart Stay, which is a feature that keeps your phone's screen on as long as you are looking at it. Smart Stay uses your phone's front camera to do this. This setting will override your the screen timeout settings. Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the screen and tap the icon that resembles a gear to open the Settings menu. 6. Scroll down and tap Advanced features . It's fairly close to the bottom of the menu. It's next to a yellow icon that resembles a gear with a plus (+) sign in the middle. You may have to select Controls on some models. If you are unable to locate the Smart Stay option in your Settings menu, tap the magnifying glass icon in the upper-right corner of the menu and type "Smart Stay" in the search bar. This feature may not be available on all Samsung Galaxy devices. 7. Tap Motions and gestures . It's near the bottom of the Advanced Features menu. 8. Tap Smart Stay . Now you'll see the Smart Stay switch. If Smart Stay is disabled, the switch will be gray or white. If it's another color, Smart Stay is already turned on. You can tap the colored switch to disable Smart Stay if you don't want to use your phone's camera to sense whether you are looking at the screen. 9. Slide the switch to the On position . Once Smart Stay is enabled, your Android's screen will stay illuminated as long as the camera can sense your face. Smart Stay may not work properly in a dark room due to its dependence on the camera.

Gemini_text:
Here's how to change the screen timeout on your Android device:

**Step 1: Open Settings**
Locate and tap on the "Settings" icon on your home screen or in your app drawer. It usually looks like a gear.
**Step 2: Navigate to Display Settings**
In the Settings menu, scroll down and tap on "Display" (or "Display & Brightness" on some devices).
**Step 3: Find Screen Timeout**
Within the Display settings, look for an option called "Screen timeout," "Sleep," or "Display timeout" and tap on it.
**Step 4: Select Timeout Duration**
A list of options will appear, ranging from a few seconds to several minutes (or "Never" on some devices). Choose your desired screen timeout duration.

Bagel_text:
Changing the screen timeout on an Android device can help save battery life and reduce eye strain. Here are the steps to change the screen timeout on an Android device:

**Method 1: Using the Settings app**

1. Open the **Settings** app on your Android device.
2. Scroll down and tap on **Display**.
3. Tap on **Screen timeout**.
4. Choose the desired timeout duration from the list: **Never**, **1 minute**, **5 minutes**, **15 minutes**, **30 minutes**, or **1 hour**.
5. Tap **OK** to save the changes.

**Method 2: Using the Quick Settings panel**

1. Swipe down from the top of the screen to open the **Quick Settings** panel.
2. Tap and hold on the **Screen timeout** icon (it looks like a clock).
3. Choose the desired timeout duration from the list: **Never**, **1 minute**, **5 minutes**, **15 minutes**, **30 minutes**, or **1 hour**.
4. Release the tap to save the changes.

**Method 3: Using the Accessibility settings**

1. Open the **Settings** app on your Android device.
2. Scroll down and tap on **Accessibility**.
3. Tap on **Display**.
4. Tap on **Screen timeout**.
5. Choose the desired timeout duration from the list: **Never**, **1 minute**, **5 minutes**, **15 minutes**, **30 minutes**, or **1 hour**.
6. Tap **OK** to save the changes.

That's it! Your screen timeout has been changed. You can always go back to the same settings to adjust the timeout duration as needed.

prompt: How to Create a Photo Album on Facebook? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Facebook app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. It's the blue-and-white "f" icon typically found on the home screen or in the app drawer. 2. Tap What's on your mind? or Write something here . One of these options will appear at the top of the screen below the story icons. 3. Tap Photo/Video . It's the green photo icon below the typing area. This opens your phone or tablet's camera roll. If you haven't yet given Facebook permission to access your photos, follow the on-screen instructions to do so when prompted. 4. Select photos to include in the album. The photos you select will appear in the album in the order they're selected. 5. Tap Done when you're finished. It's at the top-right corner. 6. Tap the + Album button. It's near the top of the screen just below your name. 7. Tap + Create Album . It's the first option at the top of the menu. 8. Enter an album title and description. The album's title is mandatory, but the description is optional. Tap the Album name field to enter a descriptive name for your album, and the Add a description field (optional) to type anything else you'd like to include about the photos. 9. Select an audience. The privacy menu is just below the "Description" field. It'll be set to your default post privacy setting by default. If you want to change who can see your album, tap the menu and select one of these options: Public (anyone on Facebook) Friends (your Facebook friends) Friends except… (all friends except any you add to a list) Specific friends (only friends you add to a list) Only me (private) 10. Allow friends to add photos (optional). If you'd like certain Facebook friends to be able to contribute their own photos to this album, slide the "Add Contributors" switch to the On (blue) position, and then tap Choose Friends to select some friends. If not, leave this switch alone. 11. Tap Save (iPhone/iPad) or CREATE (Android). This prepares the selected photos for your new album. 12. Tap Upload (iPhone/iPad) or Post (Android). This uploads the selected photos and adds them to your new album. You'll find your album in the Photos section of your profile.

Gemini_text:
Here's how to create a photo album on Facebook, with visual steps to guide you:

1.  **Go to your profile:** On your Facebook homepage, click on your profile picture or name to navigate to your profile.
    

2.  **Click on "Photos":** Once on your profile, locate and click on the "Photos" tab, usually found below your cover photo.
    

3.  **Select "Albums" and then "Create Album":** In the Photos section, click on the "Albums" sub-tab, and then click the "+ Create Album" button.
    4.  **Add Photos/Videos:** A window will pop up allowing you to upload photos or videos from your computer. Select the files you want to include in your album and click "Open."
    5.  **Name your album and add details:** Give your album a descriptive name, and optionally add a description and location. You can also adjust the privacy settings here to control who can see your album.
