Bagel_text:
Creating a photo album on Facebook is a straightforward process that allows you to organize and share your photos in a visually appealing way. Here are the steps to create a photo album on Facebook:

**Visual Steps:**

1. Log in to your Facebook account.
2. Click on the "Photos" tab on the left side of the screen.
3. Click on the "Create Album" button at the top of the page.
4. Choose the photos you want to add to the album by clicking on the "Select Photos" button.
5. Select the photos you want to add to the album by checking the boxes next to each photo.
6. Click on the "Create Album" button to create the album.
7. Add a title and description to the album by typing in the text boxes.
8. Click on the "Save" button to save the album.

**Text Steps:**

1. Log in to your Facebook account.
2. Click on the "Photos" tab on the left side of the screen.
3. Click on the "Create Album" button at the top of the page.
4. Choose the photos you want to add to the album by clicking on the "Select Photos" button.
5. Select the photos you want to add to the album by checking the boxes next to each photo.
6. Click on the "Create Album" button to create the album.
7. Add a title and description to the album by typing in the text boxes.
8. Click on the "Save" button to save the album.

That's it! You have successfully created a photo album on Facebook. You can now share the album with your friends and family, or even make it public for everyone to see.

prompt: How to check for updates in Windows 11? Show screenshot steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open Settings by pressing ⊞ Win + I . You can also open Settings by going to the Start menu and clicking the gear icon. 2. Click Windows Update . It's the last thing on the menu on the left side of the window. Alternatively, open this page directly by pressing the Win key and entering updates and clicking the app search result. This will open the Settings menu to the Windows Updates window. 3. Click Check for Windows Updates . If an update is available, click Download & Install, then restart your computer when prompted. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source 4. Open Settings and Windows Update . Use this menu to change your update preferences. For example, if you want to get updates as soon as they are available, enable the toggle next to "Get the latest updates…" under the "More options" heading. Click the drop-down menu next to "Pause updates" to not automatically get updates for a specified time period. See your update history by clicking Update history . This helps you roll back updates that break compatibility with some devices. 5. Open "Update & Security" in Settings. Press Win + I and click the "Update & Security" tile. Follow this method if your computer meets the requirements for Windows 11. Lots of older computers don't have the necessary software, so your computer may not meet the requirements. Use the PC Health Check app from Microsoft to see if your computer is eligible to upgrade. If your computer is eligible, you need to enable Secure Boot and TPM 2.0 , which you can do in your UEFI Firmware settings. You want to back up your files before upgrading , so you have them if something goes wrong.

prompt: How to Open Incognito Mode by Default in Google Chrome (Windows)? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Create a new shortcut for Google Chrome on your desktop. It won't be possible to modify the Chrome shortcut that's in your Start menu or on your taskbar, but you can create a special incognito mode shortcut for your desktop. Here's an easy way to do this: First, if you already have a Google Chrome icon on your desktop, you can skip this step. Otherwise, click the Start menu or press the Windows key on your keyboard to open the menu. Locate the Chrome icon (it's the round red, green, yellow, and blue icon) but don't click it. Drag the Chrome icon to your desktop. This places a new icon called Google Chrome onto your desktop. If you can't see the desktop, press Windows key + D , return to the menu, and then drag the icon. If you already had a Chrome icon on your desktop, this new shortcut will be called Google Chrome (2) . 2. Right-click the Google Chrome icon on your desktop. A menu will expand. 3. Click Properties on the menu. This opens the Google Chrome Properties dialog window. 4. Add -incognito to the end of the "Target" field. Look at the address you see next to "Target" –this is the full path to Google Chrome. You'll need to add -incognito after that path. Since the last character is a quotation mark ("), click the mouse after the quotation, press the spacebar, and then type -incognito . For example: "C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe" -incognito You can restore your previous setting by removing -incognito from the Target text box and saving it. 5. Click OK . This saves your changes. 6. Rename the new Google Chrome icon on your desktop (optional). It may be helpful to rename the desktop icon to something like "Chrome Incognito" so you know what it does. To do this, right-click the Chrome icon on your desktop, select Rename , type Chrome Incognito , and then press the Enter key. 7. Double-click the Google Chrome icon on your desktop. As long as you open Chrome by double-clicking this icon, it will always open in incognito mode. If you open Chrome from your Windows Start menu or in any way other than double-clicking this new icon on your desktop, Chrome will not open in incognito mode. Remember to always double-click the icon that's on your desktop to open the incognito version of Chrome. You can still switch to incognito mode from a standard Chrome window by pressing Ctrl + Shift + N on the keyboard.

Gemini_text:
You can't set Incognito mode as the default in Google Chrome directly through settings. However, you can create a shortcut that launches Chrome directly into Incognito mode every time you use it. Here's how:

**Step 1:** Right-click on your Google Chrome shortcut (either on your desktop, taskbar, or Start Menu) and select "Properties." If you don't have a shortcut, you can create one by finding chrome.exe in your program files, right-clicking it, and selecting "Send to" > "Desktop (create shortcut)."

**Step 2:** In the "Properties" window, go to the "Shortcut" tab. Locate the "Target" field.

**Step 3:** At the end of the existing path in the "Target" field, add a space and then `--incognito`. It should look something like this:

`"C:\Program Files\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe" --incognito`

**Step 4:** Click "Apply" and then "OK."

Now, whenever you open Google Chrome using this modified shortcut, it will launch directly into Incognito mode.

Bagel_text:
Opening Incognito Mode by default in Google Chrome on Windows can be a bit tricky, but it's a useful feature to have. Here are the steps to do it:

**Method 1: Using the Chrome Settings**

1. Open Google Chrome on your Windows computer.
2. Click on the three vertical dots in the top right corner of the browser window.
3. Click on "Settings" from the drop-down menu.
4. Scroll down to the "On startup" section.
5. Click on "Open a specific page or set of pages."
6. Click on "Add a new page."
7. In the "New page" dialog box, click on "Incognito" from the drop-down menu.
8. Click on "Add" to add the Incognito page to the list.
9. Click on "Save" to save the changes.

**Method 2: Using the Chrome Flags**

1. Open Google Chrome on your Windows computer.
2. Type "chrome://flags/" in the address bar and press Enter.
3. Scroll down to the "Incognito" section.
4. Click on "Enable Incognito mode by default" and select "Enabled" from the drop-down menu.
5. Click on "Relaunch" to restart Chrome.

**Method 3: Using the Chrome Shortcuts**

1. Open Google Chrome on your Windows computer.
2. Press the Windows key + R to open the Run dialog box.
3. Type "chrome.exe --incognito" and press Enter.
4. This will open a new Incognito window.

**Method 4: Using the Chrome Menu**

1. Open Google Chrome on your Windows computer.
2. Click on the three vertical dots in the top right corner of the browser window.
3. Click on "More tools" from the drop-down menu.
4. Click on "Incognito mode" from the drop-down menu.
5. Click on "Open Incognito window" to open a new Incognito window.

**Method 5: Using the Chrome Keyboard Shortcut**

1. Open Google Chrome on your Windows computer.
2. Press the Ctrl + Shift + N keys to open a new Incognito window.

Once you have completed one of these methods, you will have Incognito Mode enabled by default in Google Chrome on your Windows computer.

prompt: How to check data usage on Android? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open your Android's Settings. It's the icon typically found on the home screen or in the app drawer. 2. Tap Data usage . You should now see the total amount of mobile data used in the current month at the top of the screen. 3. Select a date range. Skip this step if you only want to see the current month's usage. Tap the drop-down menu that contains the current month's dates, then select the date for which you want to view usage data. 4. Tap App usage . It's a blue link near the bottom of the page. The total data used appears at the top of the screen, and you'll also see how much data was used by each app. Apps that used the most data appear at the top of the page.

Gemini_text:
Here's how you can check your data usage on an Android device:

**Step 1: Open Settings**

First, open the "Settings" app on your Android phone. You can usually find it by swiping down from the top of your screen and tapping the gear icon, or by looking for the "Settings" app in your app drawer.
**Step 2: Go to "Network & internet" or "Connections"**

In the Settings menu, look for an option like "Network & internet," "Connections," or something similar. The exact wording might vary depending on your phone model and Android version.
 The image shows a close-up of an Android phone with the screen displaying settings. An arrow is pointing to an icon for "Data Usage" indicating where to tap next. In this section, you should see "Data usage." Tap on it.
The "Data usage" screen will display a summary of your mobile data consumption over a specific period. You can often see a graph showing your usage, total data used, and a list of apps that are consuming the most data.

From this screen, you can also often set data warnings or limits to help you stay within your data plan.

Bagel_text:
To check data usage on Android, follow these steps:

**Visual Steps:**

1. Open the **Settings** app on your Android device.
2. Scroll down and tap on **Network & internet**.
3. Tap on **Mobile network**.
4. Tap on **Data usage**.

**Text Steps:**

1. Open the **Settings** app on your Android device.
2. Scroll down and tap on **Network & internet**.
3. Tap on **Mobile network**.
4. Tap on **Data usage**.

**What you'll see:**

You'll see a list of all the apps that have used data on your device, along with the amount of data used by each app. You can also see the total amount of data used by your device, as well as the amount of data used by your mobile network.

**Tips:**

* To see more detailed information about an app's data usage, tap on the app's name.
* To limit data usage for an app, tap on the app's name and then tap on **Data usage**. From there, you can toggle off data usage for the app.
* To see data usage for a specific time period, tap on the **Data usage** screen and then tap on **Data usage history**. From there, you can select a specific time period to view data usage.

That's it! You should now be able to check your data usage on your Android device.

prompt: How to Uninstall Google Chrome? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Close any open Google Chrome windows. Windows won't uninstall a program if it is currently running; closing Chrome will prevent this problem from occurring. 2. Force-quit Chrome if necessary. To avoid errors saying that Google Chrome is still running even though you've closed all of its windows, check to make sure all Google Chrome processes have stopped and force-quit any Google Chrome processes still running. Use the following steps to force-quit Google Chrome: Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + Esc to open the Task Manager. Click the Processes tab. Click Google Chrome in the main window. Click End task in the bottom-right corner of the Task Manager. On Windows 11, you can right-click Google Chrome and choose End task instead. 3. Right-click the Windows icon and click Apps & programs . If you're using Windows 11, you'll instead click Installed apps . 4. Scroll down and click Google Chrome . You'll find Google Chrome in the "G" section of the list of currently installed apps. If you don't see Chrome here, make sure you're sorting by name by clicking the "Sort by" option and then clicking Name . 5. Click Uninstall twice. You'll click Uninstall once under Google Chrome's name, then you'll click it again when it pops up above Google Chrome's name. 6. Click Yes when prompted. This will allow Google Chrome to run its uninstaller. 7. Click Uninstall when prompted. Doing so will prompt Google Chrome to uninstall. You may also want to have Chrome delete your browsing history by checking the "Also delete your browsing data?" box. 8. Delete the Google Chrome installation folder if necessary. If you still see the Google Chrome icon in the taskbar, desktop, or Start menu, or you reinstall Google Chrome and continue to experience issues with it, you may need to delete the Google Chrome installation folders. First, make sure you have hidden files and folders showing in File Explorer. Then use the following steps to delete the Google Chrome installation folders: Press ⊞ Win + E to open File Explorer. Click your Windows Installation (C:) drive. Open the following folders: users > Your Username > AppData > Local > Google . Right-click the Chrome folder and click Delete . Open the following folders: Program Files (x86) > Google . 9. Close Google Chrome. Hold down Ctrl while clicking the Google Chrome app icon in your Mac's Dock, then click Quit in the resulting pop-up window. If Google Chrome is already closed, you won't see Quit in the menu. 10. Force-quit Chrome if necessary. If you're receiving errors that say Chrome is running even though you've closed it, do the following before attempting to uninstall Google Chrome: Press ⌥ Option + ⌘ Command + Esc at the same time. Select Google Chrome in the pop-up window. Click Force Quit in the bottom-right corner of the pop-up window. Click Force Quit when prompted. 11. Open Finder. Click the Finder app icon, which resembles a blue face, in the Dock. 12. Click Go . It's a menu item at the top of your Mac's screen. A drop-down menu will appear. 13. Click Applications . You'll find this option in the drop-down menu. Doing so opens a list of your Mac's installed applications. 14. Locate Google Chrome. Google Chrome is the red, green, yellow, and blue app here, though you may have to scroll down to find it. 15. Place Google Chrome in the Trash. Click and drag the Chrome app icon onto the Trash icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen, then release it there. This will remove Chrome from your Mac. 16. Delete the Chrome installation folder if necessary. If you still see the Google Chrome icon in the Dock or Applications folder, or you try to reinstall Google Chrome and it has the same issues as before, you may need to delete the installation folder. Use the following steps to delete the installation folder: Open Finder . Click Go . Hold " Option " and click Library . Open the Application Support folder followed by the Google folder. Drag and drop the Chrome folder into the Trash. 17. Locate the Google Chrome app. It's white with a yellow, green, red, and blue sphere on it. 18. Tap and hold Google Chrome. After a second, a menu will pop up with several options. 19. Tap Remove App . This is the first option on the menu. 20. Select Delete App . This option will completely delete Chrome and associated data from your iPhone. Select Delete App , then tap Delete in the popup window to confirm. This process will also work on an iPad or iPod touch. 21. Open your Android's Settings. Swipe down from the top of your Android's screen, then tap the gear-shaped "Settings" icon in the top-right corner of the resulting drop-down menu. On some Androids, you must use two fingers to swipe down. If Google Chrome came pre-installed on your Android phone, you cannot uninstall it. You can only disable it. If you need to clear space on your Android phone, you can delete the cache , cookies, and history . 22. Tap Apps . It's in the Settings menu. Doing so opens a list of your Android's installed apps. 23. Find and select Chrome. Scroll down until you find the red, yellow, green, and blue sphere-shaped Chrome app icon, then tap it. 24. Tap UNINSTALL . This option is below the "Google Chrome" heading at the top of the screen. If you instead see DISABLE here, Chrome cannot be uninstalled from your Android. To disable and hide Chrome, tap DISABLE and then tap DISABLE when prompted. 25. Tap UNINSTALL when prompted. Doing so will uninstall Chrome from your Android.

Gemini_text:
Here are the steps to uninstall Google Chrome, with accompanying visuals:

**Step 1: Open Settings**

Click on the Start menu in the bottom left corner of your screen, then click on the "Settings" gear icon.
**Step 2: Go to Apps**

In the Settings window, click on "Apps."
**Step 3: Find Google Chrome**

Scroll down the list of installed apps until you find "Google Chrome." Click on it.
**Step 4: Uninstall Google Chrome**

After clicking on Google Chrome, an "Uninstall" button will appear. Click on it, then confirm your decision in the pop-up window. You may also be given an option to "Delete browsing data." If you want to remove all your browsing history, cookies, and other site data, check this box.
After following these steps, Google Chrome will be uninstalled from your computer.

Bagel_text:
Uninstalling Google Chrome can be a bit tricky if you're not familiar with the process. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to uninstall Google Chrome on Windows, macOS, and Linux:

**Windows:**

1. **Close Google Chrome**: Make sure to close Google Chrome before uninstalling it.
2. **Open the Start menu**: Click on the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of your screen.
3. **Type "控制面板" (Control Panel) in the search bar**: This will open the Control Panel.
4. **Click on "卸载程序" (Programs and Features)**: This will open the Programs and Features window.
5. **Find Google Chrome**: Scroll through the list of installed programs to find Google Chrome.
6. **Right-click on Google Chrome**: A context menu will appear.
7. **Click "卸载" (Uninstall)**: This will start the uninstallation process.
8. **Follow the prompts**: The uninstallation process will guide you through the steps. Just click "Next" and "Yes" as prompted.
9. **Restart your computer**: Once the uninstallation is complete, restart your computer.

**macOS:**

1. **Close Google Chrome**: Make sure to close Google Chrome before uninstalling it.
2. **Open the Applications folder**: Click on the Applications folder in the Dock or navigate to /Applications using the Finder.
3. **Find Google Chrome**: Scroll through the list of applications to find Google Chrome.
4. **Right-click on Google Chrome**: A context menu will appear.
5. **Click "显示包内容" (Show Package Contents)**: This will open the Google Chrome folder.
6. **Open the Contents folder**: This will open the Contents folder.
7. **Open the Macromedia folder**: This will open the Macromedia folder.
8. **Open the Flash folder**: This will open the Flash folder.
9. **Delete the Flash folder**: This will delete the Flash folder and all its contents.
10. **Delete Google Chrome**: Drag Google Chrome to the Trash can in the Dock.
11. **Empty the Trash can**: Right-click on the Trash can and select "Empty Trash".

**Linux:**

1. **Close Google Chrome**: Make sure to close Google Chrome before uninstalling it.
2. **Open the terminal**: You can open the terminal by searching for "Terminal" in the Start menu or by pressing the Windows key + R and typing "Terminal".
3. **Type the following command**: `sudo apt-get remove google-chrome-stable`
4. **Press Enter**: This will start the uninstallation process.
5. **Follow the prompts**: The uninstallation process will guide you through the steps. Just press Enter as prompted.
6. **Restart your computer**: Once the uninstallation is complete, restart your computer.

That's it! Google Chrome should now be uninstalled from your computer.

prompt: How to Write in Another Language on Your Mac Computer? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Click on the Apple menu and then System Settings . The Apple menu opens when you click the black apple icon in the upper-left corner of the screen. 2. Click Keyboard . It's in the sidebar menu on the left of the System Settings window. You might have to scroll down to find it. 3. Click Edit next to "Input Sources." You'll see this on the right side of the window under the "Text Input" header with a list of current languages. 4. Click ➕ below the left pane of the dialog box. You'll find the plus sign icon below the left pane where your keyboard's current languages are displayed. Clicking this will allow you to add another language to your keyboard so you can easily switch to it. 5. Click on a language. They're listed alphabetically. Keyboard languages that have already been added are at the top of the list. 6. Click the desired keyboard/input style for the language. They're displayed in the right pane of the dialog box. An example of the keyboard layout will appear below the right pane when you click on an input source. 7. Click on Add . You'll be able to type in that language now, but you still have to switch your keyboard to that language. Follow the next steps to switch. 8. Toggle on Show Input menu in menu bar . Make sure the toggle next to "Show input menu in menu bar" is enabled (showing blue) so you can quickly switch your keyboard language. You'll see this option at the top of the Input Sources menu. When you're finished, click Done at the bottom right corner of the window. 9. Click on the flag or language icon on the right side of the menu bar. Look for a symbol in the menu bar at the top of your Mac's screen. It should look like a flag or a rectangle containing a language symbol (such as US for American English). Click it to open a dropdown menu. 10. Click on the language you want to use with your keyboard. Follow the same steps whenever you want to change the language again. Alternatively, press the Globe key to change your input language. If pressing it does nothing or something else, go to System Settings > Keyboard and make sure the Globe key is set to change your input source.

Gemini_text:
There are two main ways to write in another language on your Mac:

**Method 1: Using the Input Menu**

This method is best for languages where the alphabet is significantly different from English or requires special characters.

**Step 1: Open System Settings (or System Preferences).**
Click the Apple menu in the top-left corner of your screen and select "System Settings" (or "System Preferences" if you're on an older macOS version).

**Step 2: Navigate to Keyboard Settings.**
In the System Settings window, scroll down and click on "Keyboard" in the sidebar.

**Step 3: Access Input Sources.**
Click the "Input Sources" button. This will open a window where you can manage your keyboard layouts.

**Step 4: Add a New Language.**
Click the "+" button at the bottom left of the Input Sources window.

**Step 5: Select Your Language.**
A list of languages will appear. Search for or scroll to the language you want to add and select it. Then, choose the specific input method you prefer for that language (e.g., "ABC - Extended" for a phonetic input, or a specific keyboard layout). Click "Add."
**Step 6: Switch Languages.**
Once added, you'll see a flag or a language indicator in the menu bar at the top of your screen. Click on it to switch between your added languages. You can also use the keyboard shortcut `Control + Space` (or `Command + Space` if you've customized it) to cycle through input sources.
**Method 2: Using the Character Viewer (for occasional special characters)**

This method is useful if you only need to insert a few special characters from another language occasionally, rather than typing extensively in it.

**Step 1: Open the Character Viewer.**
While typing in any application, place your cursor where you want to insert a special character. Go to the "Edit" menu in the application's menu bar and select "Emoji & Symbols" (or press `Control + Command + Space`).

**Step 2: Browse and Insert Characters.**
The Character Viewer will appear. You can browse by category, search for specific characters, or use the language-specific sections. Double-click a character to insert it into your text.

Bagel_text:
Writing in another language on your Mac computer can be a bit tricky, but it's definitely possible. Here are the steps to help you do so:

1. **Set Your Language Preference:**
   - Go to **System Preferences** on your Mac.
   - Click on **Language & Region**.
   - In the **Language** tab, click on **+** to add a new language.
   - Select the language you want to use and click **Add**.

2. **Install the Language Input Method:**
   - Once you've added the language, you'll need to install the input method for that language.
   - Click on the **Language & Region** preference pane and then click on **Input Sources**.
   - Click on **+** to add a new input source.
   - Select the language you added and click **Add**.

3. **Configure the Input Method:**
   - Click on the **Language & Region** preference pane and then click on **Input Sources**.
   - Select the language you want to use and click on **Options**.
   - Choose the input method you want to use for that language. For example, for Chinese, you might choose Simplified Chinese or Traditional Chinese.
   - Click **OK** to save the changes.

4. **Use the Language:**
   - Click on the **Language & Region** preference pane and then click on **Language**.
   - Select the language you want to use from the list.
   - Type in the language using the input method you configured. You can also use the keyboard shortcuts to switch between languages.

5. **Use the Language in Applications:**
   - Open any application on your Mac.
   - Click on **Edit** in the menu bar and then click on **Language**.
   - Select the language you want to use from the list.

6. **Use the Language in System Preferences:**

prompt: How to Change the Language on an iPhone or iPad? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open your iPhone's Settings . This is the grey cog icon. Be sure to update your iPhone . 2. Tap General . You may need to scroll down to find it. 3. Tap Language & Region . This will be in the same group as Date & Time . You can also use this page to change your region . 4. Tap Add Language… . This is in blue underneath the ' Preferred Languages banner. A new page will open. 5. Select a new language. You can scroll down to find a language or use the search bar at the top. A pop-up menu will open. 6. Set your primary language. You can select the new language as your primary language or keep your current primary language (usually English). Once the language has been changed to your preferred one, you'll be back at the "Language & Region" screen. Adding a language will also add a new keyboard for that language. 7. Change your primary language back to English (optional). When your language changes, you'll still have the previous language underneath the Preferred Languages header. The one set as primary will be at the top, and any other languages will be below it. To change your primary language back to English: Tap and hold the ☰ next to English. Drag it to the top. Tap the red words in the pop-up menu. This confirms the primary language change.

Gemini_text:
Changing the language on your iPhone or iPad is a straightforward process. Here's how to do it, with visual aids for each step:

**Step 1: Open the Settings App**

First, you'll need to locate and tap on the "Settings" app icon on your device's home screen. It typically looks like a set of gears.

**Step 2: Scroll Down and Tap "General"**

Once inside the Settings menu, scroll down until you find "General" and tap on it. It's usually a few sections down.

**Step 3: Tap "Language & Region"**

Within the "General" settings, scroll down a bit further until you see "Language & Region" and tap it.

**Step 4: Tap "iPhone/iPad Language"**

At the top of the "Language & Region" screen, you'll see "iPhone Language" (or "iPad Language"). Tap on it.

**Step 5: Select Your Desired Language**

Now you'll see a long list of available languages. Scroll through and tap on the language you wish to use.

**Step 6: Confirm the Change**

After selecting your language, a pop-up will appear asking if you want to "Change to [Selected Language]". Tap on the blue option to confirm. Your device will then briefly go dark and restart with the new language applied.

Bagel_text:
Changing the language on an iPhone or iPad is a straightforward process that can be done in a few simple steps. Here's a step-by-step guide with visual aids to help you through the process:

### Step-by-Step Guide to Change Language on iPhone or iPad

#### Step 1: Open Settings
- **Visual Aid**: A screenshot of the home screen with the Settings app icon highlighted.
- **Text**: Tap on the Settings app icon on your home screen.

#### Step 2: Scroll Down and Tap on "General"
- **Visual Aid**: A screenshot of the Settings menu with the "General" option highlighted.
- **Text**: In the Settings menu, scroll down and tap on "General."

#### Step 3: Tap on "Language & Region"
- **Visual Aid**: A screenshot of the General settings menu with the "Language & Region" option highlighted.
- **Text**: In the General settings, tap on "Language & Region."

#### Step 4: Tap on "Language"
- **Visual Aid**: A screenshot of the Language & Region settings with the "Language" option highlighted.
- **Text**: In the Language & Region settings, tap on "Language."

#### Step 5: Tap on "Edit"
- **Visual Aid**: A screenshot of the Language settings with the "Edit" option highlighted.
- **Text**: In the Language settings, tap on "Edit."

#### Step 6: Select the Language You Want to Add
- **Visual Aid**: A screenshot of the Language settings with a list of languages and a "+" button to add a new language.
- **Text**: Tap on the "+" button to add a new language. A list of languages will appear. Select the language you want to add.

#### Step 7: Move the Language to the Top
- **Visual Aid**: A screenshot of the Language settings with the language you added and a "Done" button.
- **Text**: Once you've added the language, it will appear at the bottom of the list. To move it to the top, tap on the three dots next to the language and then tap "Move to Top."

#### Step 8: Tap on "Done"
- **Visual Aid**: A screenshot of the Language settings with the "Done" button highlighted.
- **Text**: After moving the language to the top, tap on "Done" to save the changes.

### Summary
1. Open Settings.
2. Scroll down and tap on "General."
3. Tap on "Language & Region."
4. Tap on "Language."
5. Tap on "Edit."
6. Select the language you want to add.
7. Move the language to the top.
8. Tap on "Done."

By following these steps, you can easily change the language on your iPhone or iPad.

prompt: How to Enable Cookies in Your Internet Web Browser? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Click the three-dot menu at the top-right corner of Chrome ⋮ . This opens the Chrome menu. Cookies are enabled by default in Chrome. You won't have to turn them on unless you disabled them in the past. 2. Click Settings on the menu. 3. Scroll down and click Site Settings . You'll find this option under the "Privacy and security" heading in the right panel. 4. Click Cookies and site data . This is the first option under the "Content" header in the right panel. 5. Select which cookies you want to allow. You have three options for enabling cookies: To allow all cookies, including those meant to track your browsing on other websites, select Allow all cookies . To allow all cookies except tracking cookies from third parties, select Block third-party cookies . This option may break some features on websites, but it will protect your privacy from trackers. To only block third-party cookies in Incognito mode , select Block third-party cookies in Incognito . This allows all cookies except when you open a new Incognito window. 6. Adjust your cookie preferences for specific sites. The "See all cookies and data" section allows you to specify cookie settings by website. In most cases you won't need to adjust this setting, but if you'd like to choose which sites can always use cookies, can never use cookies, or which sites' cookies should be deleted upon closing Chrome, click Add to add a website now.

The answer must specify which web browser the instructions are for (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Safari).

The answer should explain the implications of choosing different cookie settings, especially the distinction between allowing all cookies and blocking third-party cookies.
The answer should acknowledge that cookies are often enabled by default and the user is typically adjusting permission levels rather than enabling them from a disabled state.

### Google Chrome

1.  **Open Chrome Settings:** Click the three-dot menu icon in the top right corner of your browser, then select "Settings."

Bagel_text:
Enabling cookies in your internet web browser is a straightforward process that can be done in a few simple steps. Here are the steps to enable cookies in popular web browsers:

### Google Chrome
1. **Open Google Chrome**: Launch the Google Chrome browser on your computer.
2. **Click on the Menu Icon**: Click on the three vertical dots in the top right corner of the browser window.
3. **Select Settings**: From the drop-down menu, select "Settings".
4. **Scroll Down to Privacy and Security**: Scroll down to the "Privacy and security" section.
5. **Click on Site Settings**: Click on "Site settings".
6. **Select Cookies**: Click on "Cookies".
7. **Enable Cookies**: Toggle the switch next to "Cookies" to the "On" position.

### Mozilla Firefox
1. **Open Mozilla Firefox**: Launch the Mozilla Firefox browser on your computer.
2. **Click on the Menu Icon**: Click on the three horizontal lines in the top right corner of the browser window.
3. **Select Options**: From the drop-down menu, select "Options".
4. **Click on Privacy & Security**: Click on the "Privacy & Security" tab.
5. **Enable Cookies**: Toggle the switch next to "Accept cookies from sites" to the "On" position.

### Microsoft Edge
1. **Open Microsoft Edge**: Launch the Microsoft Edge browser on your computer.
2. **Click on the Menu Icon**: Click on the three horizontal dots in the top right corner of the browser window.
3. **Select Settings**: From the drop-down menu, select "Settings".
4. **Scroll Down to Cookies**: Scroll down to the "Cookies" section.
5. **Enable Cookies**: Toggle the switch next to "Cookies" to the "On" position.

### Safari (on Mac)
1. **Open Safari**: Launch the Safari browser on your Mac.
2. **Click on Safari**: Click on the "Safari" menu in the top left corner of the screen.
3. **Select Preferences**: From the drop-down menu, select "Preferences".
4. **Click on Privacy**: Click on the "Privacy" tab.
5. **Enable Cookies**: Check the box next to "Prevent cross-site tracking".

### Internet Explorer (on Windows)
1. **Open Internet Explorer**: Launch the Internet Explorer browser on your Windows computer.
2. **Click on Tools**: Click on the "Tools" menu in the top left corner of the screen.
3. **Select Internet Options**: From the drop-down menu, select "Internet Options".
4. **Click on Privacy**: Click on the "Privacy" tab.
5. **Enable Cookies**: Check the box next to "Accept cookies from sites".

By following these steps, you should be able to enable cookies in your web browser. Remember that enabling cookies can allow websites to store data on your device, which can be useful for personalized experiences but also raises privacy concerns.

prompt: How to Comment on Facebook? Provide visual steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Create a personal Facebook profile. You must be part of the Facebook system to comment on any profiles or pages. If you want to create a page for your business, you will need to start by making a personal profile to serve as administrator for the Facebook page. 2. Friend people with whom you want to interact. Most Facebook profiles limit interaction to people who have requested to connect, rather than allowing the public to comment. Use the search bar at the top of your profile to find friends based on their names. Start using Facebook’s suggestions once you have some friends. Click on the Friends tab under your cover photo. Then, click the “Find Friends” button. Scroll through the section entitled “People You May Know.” Submit a Friend Request to anyone with whom you want to interact. Return to the Friends tab to find friends through your email address. Find the section that says “Find Personal Contacts” on the right side of the page. Enter your Hotmail, Yahoo, AOL, or iCloud email. Click the “Find Friends” button and you will give Facebook permission to import email contacts and invite them to be friends. 3. Search for businesses, organizations and media that you like using the same search bar. Click “Like” to get their Facebook page updates and be able to comment on their pages. 4. Click the Home button on your profile to see the News Feed with your friends’ and pages’ status updates. You should see a fresh stream of updates every few minutes. You can also access your News Feed through third-party Facebook apps. Once you have downloaded the app to your phone, tablet or computer, enter your Facebook account details and click the “Home” or “News Feed” sections. 5. Choose a status update or post on which you would like to comment. Hover over it. Click the “Comments” box to see other comments and enable your own comments. 6. Scroll to the bottom of the existing comments. Type your comment in the box. When you are satisfied, press “Enter” to publish your comment on Facebook. 7. Edit your comment by hovering your cursor over it. Find the pencil that appears to the right of the highlighted column and click it. Click “Edit” and change your text to fix it. Your comment will list the date and time of the last edit you made. Friends can click on the “Edited” link under the comment to see what you changed. 8. Delete your comment entirely by highlighting it and clicking on the pencil icon. Choose “Delete” in the drop down box. Confirm you want to delete the comment. Beware that record of your comment may still exist on Facebook servers.

1.  **Find the post you want to comment on.** Scroll through your News Feed or visit a friend's profile until you see a post you'd like to respond to. 2.  **Click or tap the "Comment" button.** This button is usually located directly below the post, next to "Like" and "Share." 3.  **Type your comment.** A text box will appear. Type your message here. You can also add emojis, photos, or GIFs using the icons in the text box. 4.  **Press Enter or click the "Post" button.** Once you're happy with your comment, hit the Enter key on your keyboard or click the blue paper airplane icon (or "Post" button) to publish it.

prompt: How to Block People on Facebook? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open Facebook. It's a dark-blue app with a white "f" on it. This will open your Facebook News Feed if you're already logged into Facebook on your phone or tablet. If you aren't logged into Facebook, enter your email address (or phone number) and password to continue. 2. Tap ☰ . It's in either the bottom-right corner of the screen (iPhone) or the top-right corner of the screen (Android). 3. Scroll down and tap Settings . It's near the bottom of the page. Skip this step on Android. 4. Tap Account Settings . This option will take you to your Account Settings page. On Android, you must first scroll down. 5. Tap Blocking . It's in the second group of options on this page, near the bottom of the screen. For some smaller phones, you may first have to scroll down. 6. Tap the name field. It's the text box that says "Type a name or email" near the top of the screen. 7. Type in the name of the person you want to block, then tap Block . This will take you to the confirmation page. If you have this person's email address, you can type that in instead. 8. Tap Block next to the profile you want to block. Facebook will bring up several profiles that match the name you entered; tap Block to the right of the one you want to block. 9. Tap Block when prompted. It's the blue button near the bottom of the page. Doing so will block your selected user. 10. Go to Facebook's website. Go to https://www.facebook.com in your preferred browser. This will load your News Feed if you're already logged into Facebook. If you aren't already logged into Facebook, enter your email address (or phone number) and password before continuing. 11. Click on your profile picture. It is in the upper-right side of the Facebook page. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu. 12. Click "Settings & privacy . It's the fist option on the bottom of the drop-down menu. 13. Click Settings in the next selection. It's at the top of the menu. 14. Click Blocking . This tab is on the left side of the Settings page. 15. Click on Edit next to the Block users option. This will open up a menu that allows your to either add users to your block list, or view your block list. 16. Click on the "Add to blocked list" option. This opens a text box that says, "Type the name of a person". 17. Type in the person's name. This searches everyone on Facebook, but people from your friends list should be included in the search if possible. 18. Click Block next to the person you want to block. Facebook will bring up a list of people who match the name you entered; click Block next to the correct profile. 19. Click Confirm when prompted. This is the blue button at the bottom of the pop-up window. You can also select "Ban [username] and any new profiles that they create". This will also automatically ban any pages that they make if they ever make any. 20. Click Confirm again. This will block them.

Bagel_text:
Blocking someone on Facebook is a straightforward process that helps you avoid unwanted interactions. Here are the steps to block someone on Facebook, illustrated with text and images:

### Step 1: Go to the Person's Profile
1. **Open Facebook**: Log in to your Facebook account.
2. **Find the Profile**: Navigate to the profile of the person you want to block.

### Step 2: Click on the Three Dots
1. **Locate the Profile**: Once on the person's profile, look for the three vertical dots (⋯) at the top right corner of the cover photo.

### Step 3: Click on "Report/Block"
1. **Tap the Dots**: Click on the three vertical dots.
2. **Select "Report/Block"**: From the dropdown menu, select "Report/Block".

### Step 4: Choose "Block"
1. **Confirm Action**: A pop-up window will appear asking you to confirm that you want to block the person. Click "Block" to proceed.

### Step 5: Confirm Blocking
1. **Review Block**: The person will be blocked from your account. You will not be able to see their posts, and they will not be able to see yours.
2. **Close Window**: Once you confirm the block, close the pop-up window.

### Step 6: Verify Blocking
1. **Check Your Feed**: Go back to your feed to ensure that the person's posts are no longer visible.
2. **Check Their Profile**: Try visiting the person's profile to confirm that you are blocked.

### Additional Tips
- **Blocking vs. Hiding**: Blocking is a permanent action, while hiding someone's posts is temporary and can be reversed.
- **Blocking Multiple People**: You can block multiple people by following the same steps for each one.
- **Blocking on Mobile**: The process is similar on mobile devices, but you might need to use a different menu layout.

By following these steps, you can effectively block someone on Facebook, ensuring a more comfortable and respectful online experience.

prompt: How to Delete Music on Your iPhone? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the grey app with a gear icon that's likely found on the Home Screen. 2. Tap General . You should see this option toward the bottom of the screen. 3. Tap Storage & iCloud Usage . It's toward the bottom of the screen. 4. Tap Manage Storage under the "Storage" section. This section is at the top of the page. 5. Tap Music . It's the white app with a multicolored musical note on its front. Since the apps here are organized by the amount of space they take up, your Music app's location will vary. 6. Decide on what you want to delete. You can delete every song on your iPhone from the "All Songs" category at the top of this page, or you can delete an artist from the list below "All Songs". Additionally, you can be more specific: Tap a specific artist's name to view their "Albums" page. Tapping a specific album's name to view its songs. 7. Tap Edit . It will be in the top-right corner of the screen on any of the pages within the "Music" section. 8. Tap the red circle to the left of an option. Make sure you're doing this next to the song, album, or artist you wish to remove from your iPhone. 9. Tap Delete . It's on the far-right side of your selected option. Doing so will immediately remove your song, album, or artist both from the Music app and from your iPhone. 10. Tap Done when you're finished. This option is in the top-right corner of the screen. Your selected music items are now gone from your iPhone.

Bagel_text:
Deleting music from your iPhone is a straightforward process that can be done in a few simple steps. Here's a step-by-step guide with illustrations to help you delete music from your iPhone:

### Step-by-Step Guide to Delete Music on Your iPhone

#### Step 1: Open the Music App
- **Illustration**: A screenshot of the Music app icon on the home screen.
- **Text**: Tap on the Music app icon to open it.

#### Step 2: Select the Music You Want to Delete
- **Illustration**: A screenshot of the Music app with a list of songs and an arrow pointing to a specific song.
- **Text**: Tap on the song you want to delete to select it.

#### Step 3: Tap the Three Dots
- **Illustration**: A screenshot of the selected song with a three-dot menu icon.
- **Text**: Tap on the three-dot menu icon at the top right corner of the screen.

#### Step 4: Choose "Delete Track"
- **Illustration**: A screenshot of the menu with "Delete Track" highlighted.
- **Text**: Tap on "Delete Track" from the menu.

#### Step 5: Confirm the Deletion
- **Illustration**: A screenshot of a confirmation dialog box.
- **Text**: Tap on "Delete" to confirm the deletion of the song.

#### Step 6: Repeat for Other Songs
- **Illustration**: A screenshot of the Music app with multiple songs selected.
- **Text**: Repeat the process for each song you want to delete.

#### Step 7: Check Your Library
- **Illustration**: A screenshot of the Music app with a message indicating the number of deleted songs.
- **Text**: After deleting the songs, you can check your library to ensure the songs have been removed.

### Additional Tips
- **Illustration**: A screenshot of the Music app with a trash can icon.
- **Text**: If you want to delete multiple songs at once, you can use the "Select" feature to choose multiple songs and then delete them all at once.

By following these steps, you can easily delete music from your iPhone.

prompt: How to Delete an iPhone App? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Locate the icon for the app you want to delete. It will be on one of your home screens or inside of a folder. To quickly search for an app, swipe right on the home screen, type the app's name into the Search bar at the top, and then tap the app in the search results. You can scroll through iPhone home screens by swiping left on the screen. 2. Tap and hold the icon. You don't need to press down particularly hard; simply long-press lightly over the icon for a second or so. You can lift your finger when the pop-up menu appears. If you haven't updated your iPhone to iOS 13.2, you won't see a menu. Instead, all of the icons on the screen will begin to jiggle. If you want to delete multiple apps, click "Edit home screen." 3. Tap Remove App on the menu. A confirmation window will appear. If tapping and holding the icon made the icons on your screen jiggle, tap the minus sign " - " at the top of the icon to delete it. Some apps, such as the App Store, cannot be deleted. 4. Tap Delete App to confirm. This deletes the app from your iPhone. If you select Remove from Home Screen instead of Delete App , the app will remain on your iPhone but no longer appear on your home screen--only in your App Library. Deleting an app will not cancel any in-app paid subscriptions. If you are being billed by iTunes for a particular app, see this wikiHow to learn how to cancel your subscription. 5. Swipe left on the home screen to the App Library. Depending on how many home screens you have, you may have to swipe left multiple times. You'll know you're in the right place when you see "App Library" at the top of the screen. 6. Tap App Library . It's in the search bar at the top of the screen. A list of all apps installed on your iPhone will appear. 7. Tap and hold the icon for the app you want to delete. Don't tap and hold the app's name—just its icon, which is to the left of its name. You don't need to press down particularly hard; simply long-press lightly over the icon for a second or so. You can lift your finger when the pop-up menu appears 8. Tap Delete app . It's at the bottom of the menu. A confirmation message will appear. 9. Tap Delete to confirm. This removes the app from your iPhone. Deleting an app will not cancel any in-app paid subscriptions. If you are being billed by iTunes for a particular app, see this wikiHow to learn how to cancel your subscription.

Gemini_text:
You're in luck! Deleting apps from your iPhone is a straightforward process. Here's how you can do it:

**Step 1: Locate the App**
On your iPhone's home screen, find the app you wish to delete.


**Step 2: Enter Jiggle Mode**
Tap and hold your finger on the app icon until all the app icons start to "jiggle" or shake. You'll also see a small "X" appear in the top-left corner of each app icon.


**Step 3: Tap the "X"**
Tap the "X" on the app icon you want to delete.


**Step 4: Confirm Deletion**
A pop-up will appear asking you to confirm if you want to "Delete App." Tap "Delete App" to remove the application from your iPhone.

Bagel_text:
Deleting an iPhone app is a straightforward process, and I'll guide you through it with illustrated steps and text instructions. Here's how to delete an iPhone app:

**Illustrated Steps:**

1. **Open the App Store**: Tap the App Store icon on your iPhone's home screen.
2. **Find the App**: Scroll through the list of apps or use the search bar at the top of the screen to find the app you want to delete.
3. **Tap the App**: Tap on the app you want to delete to open its details page.
4. **Tap the "X" Icon**: On the app's details page, you'll see a red "X" icon in the top right corner. Tap this icon.
5. **Confirm Deletion**: A pop-up window will appear asking if you're sure you want to delete the app. Tap "Delete" to confirm.
6. **Wait for Deletion**: The app will be removed from your iPhone, and you'll see a confirmation message.

**Text Instructions:**

1. Open the App Store on your iPhone.
2. Find the app you want to delete by scrolling through the list or using the search bar.
3. Tap on the app to open its details page.
4. Tap the red "X" icon in the top right corner of the screen.
5. A pop-up window will appear asking if you're sure you want to delete the app. Tap "Delete" to confirm.
6. Wait for the app to be removed from your iPhone. You'll see a confirmation message when the deletion is complete.

That's it! Your iPhone app has been successfully deleted.

prompt: How to Use Emojis on a Mac? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Click the Edit menu. Select “Special Characters” from the context menu. Note: Not all applications will support special characters. Alternatively, you can press Ctrl + ⌘ Command + Space on your keyboard to open the Special Characters pane, but you will need to repeat this process to insert more emojis. Click the icon in the top right corner of the pane to open the Special Characters window, which will allow you to insert multiple emojis at a time. 2. Click Emoji . You can find it in the left pane of the Special Characters window. 3. Drag and drop the Emoji icon of your choice into your text. If the program supports it, the emoji will appear where you place it.

Gemini_text:
Here are the steps to use emojis on a Mac:

**Step 1: Open the Emoji & Symbols Viewer**
The quickest way to access emojis on a Mac is by using a keyboard shortcut. Press **Control (⌃) + Command (⌘) + Spacebar** simultaneously. This will open a small pop-up window, often called the "Character Viewer" or "Emoji & Symbols" viewer, right where your cursor is.


**Step 2: Browse and Select Emojis**
Once the viewer is open, you can browse through various emoji categories. On the left side, you'll see categories like Smileys & People, Animals & Nature, Food & Drink, etc. You can also use the search bar at the top to find a specific emoji by typing keywords (e.g., "heart," "cat," "pizza").


**Step 3: Insert the Emoji**
To insert an emoji, simply click on it in the viewer. It will instantly appear at the current cursor position in your text field (e.g., a document, an email, a message). You can click multiple emojis to insert them one after another.

Bagel_text:
Using emojis on a Mac is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to follow:

1. **Open an Application Where You Can Type Text**: You can use any application that allows you to type text, such as a web browser, a word processor, or a messaging app.

2. **Access the Emoji Keyboard**: On a Mac, you can access the emoji keyboard by pressing the "Control" key and the "Command" key together, then pressing the "Space" bar. This will bring up the emoji keyboard.

3. **Select an Emoji**: Once the emoji keyboard is open, you can scroll through the available emojis by using the arrow keys on your keyboard. You can also use the "Page Up" and "Page Down" keys to quickly navigate through the pages of emojis.

4. **Insert the Emoji**: Once you have found the emoji you want to use, simply press the "Space" bar to insert it into your text.

5. **Customize Emojis**: Some emojis can be customized by pressing the "Option" key while selecting the emoji. This will allow you to change the color or style of the emoji.

6. **Use the Emoji Keyboard in Other Applications**: You can also use the emoji keyboard in other applications by pressing the "Control" key and the "Command" key together, then pressing the "Space" bar. This will bring up the emoji keyboard, which you can use to insert emojis into your text.

7. **Use the Emoji Keyboard in Messages**: If you are using the Messages app on your Mac, you can also use the emoji keyboard to insert emojis into your messages. Simply press the "Control" key and the "Command" key together, then press the "Space" bar to bring up the emoji keyboard.

8. **Use the Emoji Keyboard in Safari**: If you are using Safari on your Mac, you can also use the emoji keyboard to insert emojis into your web pages. Simply press the "Control" key and the "Command" key together, then press the "Space" bar to bring up the emoji keyboard.

9. **Use the Emoji Keyboard in Other Applications**: You can also use the emoji keyboard in other applications by pressing the "Control" key and the "Command" key together, then pressing the "Space" bar. This will bring up the emoji keyboard, which you can use to insert emojis into your text.

10. **Use the Emoji Keyboard in Other Devices**: You can also use the emoji keyboard on other devices, such as your iPhone or iPad, by pressing the "Control" key and the "Command" key together, then pressing the "Space" bar. This will bring up the emoji keyboard, which you can use to insert emojis into your text.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

prompt: How to Change Your Computer's Name on a Mac? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Click the menu. It’s at the top-left corner of the screen. 2. Click System Preferences… . It’s near the top of the menu. 3. Click Sharing . It’s the blue folder icon with a diamond-shaped street sign inside. 4. Type a new computer name into the blank. 5. Press ⏎ Return . The name of the computer is now updated. 6. Open up the Finder Preferences. From the Finder menu, select Finder Preferences... 7. Enable your device. In the Finder Preferences window, press Sidebar at the top. Under Devices , locate your Mac icon (it's the one with the name you just set). 8. Click the checkbox next to it. Check any other devices or servers you want to appear in the sidebar, and then close the window. Your Mac should now appear in the Finder's sidebar.

Gemini_text:
Changing your Mac's name can be useful for identification on a network or just for personalization. Here's how you do it:

**Step 1: Open System Settings**

Click on the Apple menu in the top left corner of your screen and select "System Settings" from the dropdown menu.

**Step 2: Navigate to General Settings**

In the System Settings window, scroll down the sidebar on the left and click on "General."

**Step 3: Open About Settings**

Once you're in the General settings, click on "About" on the right side of the window.

**Step 4: Change Your Computer's Name**

In the "About" section, you'll see a field labeled "Name." Click on your current computer name and type in the new name you'd like to use. Press Enter or click outside the text field to save the change.

prompt: How to Delete Pictures on an iPad? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open the Photos app. It's a white app with a multicolored flower icon. 2. Tap Albums at the bottom of the screen. If you don't see Albums , tap the "Back" link in the upper-left corner of the screen. 3. Tap Camera Roll . It's an album in the upper-left corner of the screen. If you've enabled iCloud Photo Library on your iPad, the album will be labeled All Photos . 4. Tap Select in the upper-right corner of the screen. 5. Tap the picture(s) you want to delete. If you want to delete every photo on your iPad, you can quickly select them all rather than tapping each individual picture. 6. Tap the trash can icon in the upper-left part of the screen. 7. Tap Delete [number] Photos . Doing so moves the selected pictures to the "Recently Deleted" folder on your iPad, where they will remain for 30 days before they're permanently deleted. To delete them immediately: Tap Albums in the upper-left corner. Tap Recently Deleted . It's an album with a gray trash can icon. Scroll down if you don't see it. Tap Select in the upper-right corner of the screen. Tap the picture(s) you want to delete or tap Delete All in the upper-left corner to permanently delete all the images in the "Recently Deleted" folder. Tap Delete in the upper-left part of the screen. Doing so permanently deletes the pictures, and they will be removed from your iPad. 8. Connect your iPad to your computer. Do so by plugging your Lightning or 30-pin connector end of the charging cable into your iPad and connecting the other end to a USB Port on your computer. 9. Open Photos on your computer. It's an app that resembles a multicolored flower on a white background. 10. Click the Photos tab. It's at the top of the Photos window, to the left of the Memories tab. 11. Click on the picture you want to delete. Ctrl + click (Windows) or ⌘ + click (Mac) to select multiple pictures. Press Ctrl + A (Windows) or ⌘ + A to select all photos. 12. Press the Delete key. 13. Click Delete [number] Photos . Doing so removes the photos from your computer's Photos app as well as from your iPad.

### How to Delete Pictures on an iPad

Deleting photos from your iPad is a straightforward process. Here's a step-by-step guide:

**Step 1: Open the Photos App**
Tap the Photos app icon on your iPad's home screen. It looks like a colorful pinwheel.

**Step 2: Navigate to the desired album or "All Photos"**
Once in the Photos app, you'll see your photo library. You can browse through "Library" to see all your photos, or select a specific album from the "Albums" tab at the bottom.

**Step 3: Tap "Select"**
In the upper right corner of the screen, you'll see a "Select" button. Tap it. This will put your photo library into selection mode.

**Step 4: Select the photos you want to delete**
Tap on each photo you wish to remove. A blue checkmark will appear in the corner of each selected photo. To select multiple photos quickly, you can drag your finger across them.

Bagel_text:
Deleting pictures on an iPad is a straightforward process. Here are the steps to follow:

1. **Open the Photos App**: Tap on the Photos app icon on your iPad's home screen. It's the one with a multicolored flower on it.

2. **Select the Picture(s) You Want to Delete**: Tap on the picture(s) you want to delete. If you want to delete multiple pictures, you can tap on each one individually or select them by tapping on the first one and then swiping left on the others.

3. **Tap the Trash Icon**: Once you've selected the picture(s), look for the trash icon in the bottom left corner of the screen. It's a small bin with a line through it. Tap on it.

4. **Confirm the Deletion**: A pop-up window will appear asking if you're sure you want to delete the picture(s). Tap "Delete" to confirm.

5. **Wait for the Deletion to Complete**: The picture(s) will be deleted from your iPad. You can check the deletion by going back to the Photos app and looking for the picture(s) in your albums.

6. **If You Want to Move the Picture to the Trash**: If you want to move the picture to the Trash instead of deleting it permanently, you can do so by tapping on the picture and then tapping the "Move" button at the bottom of the screen. Then, select the Trash option from the list of albums.

7. **If You Want to Move the Picture to a Different Album**: If you want to move the picture to a different album, you can do so by tapping on the picture and then tapping the "Move" button at the bottom of the screen. Then, select the album you want to move it to from the list of albums.

8. **If You Want to Keep the Picture**: If you want to keep the picture, you can simply tap on it and then tap the "Keep" button at the bottom of the screen.

That's it! Your picture(s) should be deleted or moved to the Trash or a different album.

prompt: How to Take Screenshots on an Android? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Go to the screen you want to capture. It can be anything on your screen you want to take a picture of. It can be an image, a message, a social media post, an app, a website, etc. 2. Press and hold the Power + Volume Down buttons. The screen will either flash or make a brief animation to indicate a screenshot has been taken. If you have the volume up, you will also hear a camera shutter sound. You will then see the screenshot notification at the bottom or top of your phone, depending on your phone model. On older Android models that have a physical "Home" button below the screen, you will need to press and hold the Power button and the Home button below the screen instead. On certain LG, Motorola and HTC phones, you will need to press and hold the Power button and Volume Up button, instead of the Volume Down button. Alternatively, you can use gestures to take a screenshot. The gesture to take a screenshot is to place the edge of your hand vertically on the right side of the screen and swipe from right to left across the screen. You can also use Google Assistant to take a screenshot, simply say "Hey Google, take a screenshot." Some phones have a shortcut that allows you to take a screenshot. To view your shortcuts, swipe down from the top of the screen to view the shortcuts. Tap the screenshot icon. 3. Open the screenshot. To open the screenshot, tap the screenshot thumbnail in the notification that appears after you take a screenshot. If it asks you to select an app to open the screenshot with, tap Gallery and tap Always or Just Once . 4. Tap to share the screenshot. It's the icon with three dots connected by lines in the screenshot notification that appears after you take a screenshot. This displays apps you can share the screenshot over (i.e. social media, email, photo editing app). Tap an app to automatically attach the screenshot to a social media post, direct message, email, or open it in a photo editing app. To send the app over social media or an email, select a recipient, compose a message, and tap the Post/Send icon. 5. Mark up a screenshot. This is useful to highlight sections of a screenshot, or blackout parts of a screenshot you don't want other people to see (i.e. someone's username on social media.) Use the following steps to markup a screenshot: Tap the icon that resembles a pencil or marker tip in the screenshot notification. Tap the icon that resembles a marker, pen, or pencil. Tap a marker or pencil type. Tap the "X" icon to go to the previous menu. Tap the colored circle. Tap a color to select a color. Use your finger or a stylus to draw on the screenshot image. Tap Save . 6. Crop a screenshot. Cropping allows you to remove parts of an image you don't need and only capture the parts you do need. Use the following steps to crop a screenshot: Tap the icon that resembles two right angles forming a square in the screenshot notification. On some devices, the markup, and crop icon may be the same icon. Drag the edges of the screen inward so that the area you want to keep is highlighted. Tap Save . 7. Access your screenshots in the Gallery. Use the following steps to access all the screenshots you have taken in the Gallery: Tap icon that resembles a photograph to open the Gallery. Tap the Screenshots folder or album. Tap the screenshot you want to open.

Sure! Here are the illustrated steps on how to take screenshots on an Android device:

**Method 1: Using Physical Buttons**

This is the most common method and works on almost all Android devices.

1.  **Locate the Power and Volume Down buttons:** These are usually on the side of your phone.
    
    
2.  **Press and hold both buttons simultaneously:** You should hear a camera shutter sound or see a brief animation indicating the screenshot has been taken.
    
    3.  **Release the buttons:** The screenshot will be saved to your phone's gallery or photos app.
    
    **Method 2: Using the Notification Panel (for some Android devices)**

Some Android phones offer a quick screenshot option in the notification panel.

1.  **Swipe down from the top of your screen:** This will open the notification panel.
    
    2.  **Look for a "Screenshot" or "Screen capture" tile:** You might need to swipe left or right on the quick settings tiles to find it, or tap the edit icon to add it if it's not visible.

Bagel_text:
Taking a screenshot on an Android device is a straightforward process that can be done in a few simple steps. Here's a step-by-step guide with illustrations to help you take a screenshot on your Android device:

### Step-by-Step Guide to Taking a Screenshot on Android

#### Step 1: Prepare Your Screen
1. **Open the App or Screen You Want to Screenshot**: Make sure you have the app or screen you want to capture open on your Android device.

#### Step 2: Find the Screenshot Button
2. **Locate the Screenshot Button**: The location of the screenshot button can vary depending on the device and Android version. Commonly, it's found in the following places:
   - **Physical Buttons**: On some devices, you can use the physical buttons. For example, on a Samsung device, you might use the Power button and Volume down button simultaneously.
   - **On-Screen Keyboard**: On some devices, you can access the screenshot button through the on-screen keyboard. Look for a button that looks like a camera or a screenshot icon.
   - **Settings**: Some devices allow you to take a screenshot through the settings menu. Look for the "Screenshots" or "Capture" option.

#### Step 3: Take the Screenshot
3. **Press the Screenshot Button**: Once you've located the button, press it. The exact combination of buttons or the action you need to take will depend on your device.

#### Step 4: Confirm the Screenshot
4. **Check the Screenshot**: After taking the screenshot, you might see a notification or a preview of the screenshot. This is usually a quick way to confirm that the screenshot was taken successfully.

#### Step 5: Save or Share the Screenshot
5. **Save or Share**: You can save the screenshot to your device's gallery or share it with others through various apps and services.

### Additional Tips
- **Use a Screenshot App**: If the built-in screenshot feature doesn't work for you, you can use a third-party screenshot app. These apps often offer more features and customization options.
- **Accessibility Features**: Some devices have accessibility features that can help you take screenshots more easily, especially if you have difficulty using physical buttons.

### Example of a Screenshot Button on a Samsung Device
- **Physical Buttons**: Press the Power button and Volume down button simultaneously.
- **On-Screen Keyboard**: Look for a button that looks like a camera or a screenshot icon on the on-screen keyboard.

### Example of a Screenshot Button on a Google Pixel Device

prompt: How to Restart a Computer on a Mac? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Press Ctrl + Atl + Del on the keyboard. A screen containing several options (Lock, Switch User, Sign Out, Task Manager) will appear. It may take a few moments to appear if the computer is performing slowly. If you’re connected to the computer remotely with Remote Desktop, this shortcut won’t work. If your remote desktop client supports it, you can 'send' this key sequence, or you can open a command prompt on the remote computer and run the following command: shutdown -r -f -t 0 2. Click the Power icon. It’s a circle with a vertical line at its center at the bottom right part of the screen. 3. Click Restart . The computer will now reboot. If you have any open programs, you may be prompted to close them before the computer powers down. 4. Perform a hardware reboot. If the computer is frozen, you’ll need to do a hardware reboot. You should only do this if the previous steps didn’t work. Here’s how: Press and hold the power button on the computer until it turns off. This button is usually located on the side of your laptop, or on the front of the “tower” part of your desktop computer. Press the power button once again to turn it back on. 5. Press Ctrl + Alt + Del on the keyboard. This brings up the lock screen. If the computer is performing slowly, it may be a few moments before it appears. If you’re connected to the computer remotely with Windows Remote Desktop, the keyboard shortcut won’t work. Instead, open a command prompt on the remote computer and run the following command: shutdown –r . 6. Click the arrow next to the power button. It’s the red button at the bottom right corner of the screen. 7. Click Restart . The computer will now reboot. If you have any open programs, you may be asked to close them before the computer restarts. 8. Perform a hardware reboot. If the previous steps didn’t work, you’ll need use the power button on the computer to restart it. You should only do this if the computer will not restart. Press and hold the power button on the computer until it turns off. This button is usually located on the side of your laptop, or on the front of the “tower” part of your desktop computer. Press the power button once again to turn it back on. 9. Press Control + ⌘ Command + ⏏ Eject . This command will close all open programs and restart your Mac. If you have any unsaved work, you’ll be prompted to save it before the computer restarts. If your computer is performing slowly it may take several minutes for the computer to restart. Another way to do this is to open the Apple menu (at the top left corner of the screen) and click Restart . If you’re connected to computer remotely, you can restart it with sudo shutdown -r now . 10. Force a hardware reboot. You should only do this if you were unable to restart the computer. A hardware reboot should be a last resort step as it can cause data loss. Press and hold the power button on the keyboard’s upper right corner (or the back of a desktop computer) until it powers off. Then, press the power button again to turn the computer back on.

Restarting your Mac is a simple process. Here are the steps:

**Step 1: Save Your Work**
Before you restart, make sure to save any open documents and close all applications to prevent data loss.

**Step 2: Access the Apple Menu**
Click on the Apple logo in the top-left corner of your screen. **Step 3: Select "Restart..."**
From the dropdown menu, choose the "Restart..." option. **Step 4: Confirm Restart**
A dialog box will appear asking you to confirm if you want to restart. Click the "Restart" button. Your Mac will then begin the restart process.

prompt: How to Use FaceTime on Mobile? Provide illustrated steps and text the steps.
text_ref: 1. Open your iPhone's Settings . It's a grey app with gears on it. You'll likely find it on the Home Screen. 2. Scroll down and tap FaceTime . It's about a third of the way down the Settings page. 3. Tap Use your Apple ID for FaceTime . You'll find this option near the middle of the page. 4. Enter your Apple ID email address and password. Type in the email address and password that you use to log into your Apple account. 5. Tap Sign In . It's below the sign-in window. This will enable additional options on the FaceTime page. 6. Make sure your phone number and email address are correct. Beneath the "YOU CAN BE REACHED BY FACETIME AT" heading in the middle of the page, check the phone number and email address to ensure that they are correct. Phone numbers and email addresses with checkmarks next to them are currently places people can reach you via FaceTime. Tap a checked email address or phone number to remove the checkmark. 7. Slide FaceTime right to "On" . This switch is at the top of the screen. The switch will turn green when FaceTime is enabled. If the switch is already green, FaceTime is enabled.

Gemini_text:
FaceTime is a convenient way to stay connected with friends and family through video or audio calls. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to use it on your mobile device:

**Step 1: Open the FaceTime App**
Locate and tap the FaceTime app icon on your home screen. It typically looks like a green square with a white camera icon.

**Step 2: Start a New FaceTime Call**
Once in the app, tap the "New FaceTime" button at the top right of the screen.

**Step 3: Add Contacts**
Enter the name, email address, or phone number of the person you want to call. You can add multiple people for a group FaceTime call.

**Step 4: Choose Video or Audio**
After adding your contacts, you'll see options for "Video" and "Audio." Tap "Video" for a video call or "Audio" for an audio-only call.

**Step 5: Manage Your Call**
During the call, you'll see various controls like mute, camera flip, and end call. Tap the screen to reveal or hide these options.

Bagel_text:
Using FaceTime on mobile devices is a straightforward process that allows you to make video calls with friends and family. Here are the steps to use FaceTime on your mobile device:

**Step 1: Check if FaceTime is available on your device**
Before you start, make sure that FaceTime is available on your mobile device. FaceTime is only available on iOS devices (iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch) and macOS devices (MacBook, MacBook Air, MacBook Pro, iMac, Mac Pro, and Mac Mini). If you're using an Android device, you can use Google Duo or other video calling apps instead.

**Step 2: Open the FaceTime app**
On your iOS device, go to the App Store and download the FaceTime app if you haven't already. Once you have the app, open it by tapping on the FaceTime icon on your home screen.

**Step 3: Sign in with your Apple ID**
If you're not already signed in, enter your Apple ID and password to sign in to FaceTime. If you're using an iPhone or iPad, you can also use FaceTime with your Apple ID and password.

**Step 4: Choose a contact**
In the FaceTime app, you can choose a contact from your contacts list or search for a contact by name. You can also add a new contact by tapping on the "Add Contact" button.

**Step 5: Start a video call**
Once you've selected a contact, tap on the "Video" button to start a video call. If you're using an iPhone or iPad, you can also start a video call by tapping on the "Video" button in the FaceTime app.

**Step 6: Adjust your camera and microphone settings**
Before you start the call, you can adjust your camera and microphone settings to ensure that you're using the correct camera and microphone. Tap on the "Settings" button in the FaceTime app to adjust your settings.

**Step 7: Make the call**
Once you've adjusted your settings, tap on the "Video" button to start the call. Your contact will receive a notification that you're calling them, and they can answer the call by tapping on the "Answer" button.

**Step 8: Enjoy your FaceTime call**
Once you've started the call, you can enjoy your FaceTime call with your contact. You can use the controls in the FaceTime app to adjust your camera and microphone settings, and you can also use the "Share Play" feature to share your screen with your contact.

That's it! With these simple steps, you can use FaceTime on your mobile device to make video calls with friends and family.
